Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a 4* hotel; not sure It even deserves 3*”
Reviews.Author: Javitxus
Reviews.Content: Moved by all the good comments, my wife and I decided to book at this hotel for a romantic weekend in Paris. The result could not have been worse. The room was really tiny and the bathroom was ridiculously small. Worst of all, there was no heating in the entire hotel, not even in the room. The first night we could not sleep because we were freezing. We called reception and asked for to put the heating on, but they just answered it was turned off for the entire hotel and all we could do was turn on the towels heater in the bathroom and hope it could heat up our room a bit. We got no sleep at all. The bed mattress and sheets are so old, it is really uncomfortable to sleep on them. And also, it was really noisy from our room at night. The bell-man didn't even help my wife with her luggage - quite interesting at a 4 star hotel. It's true location is perfect, and breakfast is quite nice, but it is by far the worst hotel we've ever stayed at in Paris. However the rates correspond to a fine boutique hotel. I strongly recommend to avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful star near Etoile”
Reviews.Author: madrasmusik
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, contemporary hotel in a traditional Parisian building, in an excellent location between the Champs d'Elysees and Eiffel Tower. Rooms are compact, but very well appointed. Have stayed both on the busy Avenue Marceau side and the back side of the hotel, and both are quiet due to double windows on the front side. Nice breakfast is included in many rates, served by a cheerful woman in the atmospheric caveau downstairs. Front desk staff is quite nice and helpful. A very, very pleasant place to stay in one of the world's most charming cities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: liverpool26
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, perfect location, but most of all really helpful staff who go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. Attention given to detail, our beds where "turned down", with a refreshing wipe and a chocolate left on the pillows. Fluffy white robes in the bathroom, tea/coffee was restocked during the day, so when we came home after sightseeing the cups were fresh and we could have a cuppa (we had used all the milk/tea bags that morning). A bottle of evian and the most delicious macaroons were complimentary when we arrived. I just loved this hotel, would definately stay here again, I have been to Paris several times before, this is definately the best hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Charming Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MichelleBenjamin28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Elysses Regencia for my 4 day stay in Paris. I couldn't have been more pleased with my choice. Amazing lobby decor and the room was beautiful, with a street side view. I felt as if I was in the heart of Paris. Best of all I was centrally located within walking distance of the Arc de Triomph, and the Eiffel Tower, and for those who enjoy a leisurely stroll even close enough to the Louvre Musuem. I would definately book with Elysees Regencia again should I return to Paris. I highly suggest the same for anyone else. ~Michelle Benjamin~NY~USA

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandMatt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon. The staff could not have been friendlier. We originally booked our room at their sister hotel (Bassano)'up the street, however when we arrived they gave us the option to upgrade to their sister hotel for free. After touring both hotels, we agreed. Our bags were at the sister hotel and the bellboy pulled both of our very large, very heavy suitcases all the down the street (3blocks) to the Élysées Regencia, he then refused a tip, h what a great first impression. We stayed on the top floor and we could see the tower Eiffel from our window. The shower had jets for the top and both walls. Felt very refreshing and clean. Toiletries were l'occitane, quite nice and expensive. This hotel is a few short blocks to the Champes and 8 minute walk to the tower Eiffel. It is located in the 8th in a nice quiet neighborhood. We blended with the locals, ate at local restaurants, cafes, and markets. We plan to return. We have stayed at other boutique hotels in paris and they do not compare to this. This is a solid 4 star with 5 star service

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Nicos T
Reviews.Content: Excellent location-,five minutes walk from George V metro station,helpful staff with good recommendations, very clean. Wifi access was free in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: tcudarling
Reviews.Content: Couldnt be in a better location. Walk to train stations, restaurants and sites. Rooms and pictures depicts hotel accurately. Piano and small bar are on ground floor. Daily breakfast to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Barry L
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality hotel in a really good location. It is only a ten minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe and 20 mins from the Eiffel Tower. George V Metro station is about a ten minute walk. The rooms are very comfortable and well maintained if not huge. Wifi access was free with good reception. We arrived early in the morning and the hotel made an effort to have a room ready for us within a couple of hours with no fuss. The staff were also very helpful in arranging a late checkout on the day of departure. Breakfast is very good and we also had a good reasonable value meal in the bistro next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Elysees Regencia”
Reviews.Author: LenaScotland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location; walking distance to the Champs Elysees and the Eiffiel Tower. The room was excellent if a bit small when the extra bed was added for our son. It was very clean and the bathroom was spacious with rose petals decorating it when we arrived. One critisism would be that it was very dark in the room at night as the lighting was low level and subdued. Also there was not enough hanging space for all our clothes. The room was overlooking quite a busy road but the noise did not bother us, it was Paris! A wonderful window opened out to a small balcony which offered the aroma of the next door Bistro, wow. The breakfast was very good with lots of choices from fresh fruit to full cooked on offer. The staff were helpful and polite. We would definately recommend this hotel for a wonderful stay in Paris, we would stay there again if we get the chance to return.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: roslina z
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel & location. The manager was so helpful and he made us feel so welcome. We wanted to go to la vallee and he printed out the train routes which was so helpful. The breakfast was delicious and service excellent. Will definitely stay there again !!

Reviews.Title: “Well managed hotel, great service, good amenities”
Reviews.Author: NPatel_NJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed during a business trip and the hotel was fantastic. We didn't ask for many recommendation since we had some from friends but the staff was very pleasant and always in a good mood. Room was nice, couldn't have asked for a better stay, we are only a couple days into our trip, so far so good. Free WIFI!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judy B
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with a great location. The staff was very welcoming. We arrived by private shuttle from the Eurostar very early in the morning & they were able to get us to our room right away. We were so excited. From the Hotel we walked to the Louvre, Eiffel & all about Paris. We had purchased metro tickets, but never had to use. The breakfast is served in the stone basement & it was great each morning. We would probably try to get just a bit closer if we were coming again. But, we stayed 3 nights & enjoyed everything at this hotel. Rooms were very large & a great bath!.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Parfait”
Reviews.Author: katnegril
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for the last 4 years and find it to be an absolute gem. This is a lovely boutique hotel with a wonderful American buffet breakfast. The rooms and bathrooms are nicely appointed and decent size, however the Deluxe rooms are a bit larger and well worth the extra money. I cannot say enough about their bi-lingual reception staff and their excellent customer service skills. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Champs Elysees, the Seine river and just a few blocks to the Arc de Triomphe. Even though there is not a restaurant on site, they do offer room service from nearby restaurants. They have ample meeting space, a nice bar area and complimentary internet access in the lobby. Regencia, Je t'aime.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JillandJohn012
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Hotel Regencia in late August -Sept. It is a very comfortable, clean hotel in a great location especially for our first visit to Paris. It was close to hop on hop off bus stop, Metro, Champes Elysees, Eiffel Tower and the Arc. The online concierge was extremely helpful in securing a wonderful booking at L Jules Verne Restaurant at the Eiffel Tower. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. The bed was very comfortable and the room very quiet. The only small downside was the size of the well appointed bathroom. I believe this is the case in most hotels in Paris-small bathrooms! We would certainly stay here again and recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, good for any type of stay”
Reviews.Author: P_Stibbons
Reviews.Content: Small hotel and in Paris you can't expect the rooms to be generously sized for any reasonable price, but modern, well appointed, attractive and everything works. Mostly, it feels good to stay there. Didn't have time for any amenities, but location is excellent in terms of sight-seeing and restaurants. It's definitely on my list for a private trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: FromLongIslandNY
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel with friendly staff. The rooms are very nicely laid out albeit on the small side as to be expected. While the location is near the Eiffel Tower and the Arc, the block seems off the beaten path. Not sure if the area is residential or commercial. I prefer to be located in a neighborhood. Great choice and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place in the very city center”
Reviews.Author: Natalia_Belozerova
Reviews.Content: Very cute hotel. Staff is nice & friendly. Room is clean, very comfortable bad, nice colors used. L'occitaine bath amenities surprised me! Breakfast is good as well ( includes eggs, bakery, fresh juice). Location is just perfect, next to the very city center, eiffel tower. Nearby are lots of good restaurants with a wide choice of cousins

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, stylish modern hotel with a Parisian touch”
Reviews.Author: merrinio
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night at the Regencia for a work trip - and I was really impressed. Check-in and check-out were both efficient and friendly. Overall the hotel was stylish, modern but classic, comfortable and a little bit luxury. I had room 28 and have no complaints - spacious by Paris standards, good water pressure and good hot water :-) Also they have L'Occitane products in the bathroom (lovely). Breakfast was pretty good too - fresh juices, coffee, tea, bacon, sausage and scrambled eggs, toast, pastries, fresh fruit, cold meats, cheeses and cereal (and on request omelette, fried eggs, poached etc).

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel; tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Brit_in_Dubai
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a super location for Champs Elysees, Etile and Eiffel Tower. The lobby includes a bar and lounge. The rooms are nicely furnished in a chic simple style. Bathroom was of a high standard but it was all very small. A doiuble for one was fine but a couple might fall over each other. Good breakfast in a cave like basement. Overall: bit pricey but much as you might expect in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Tridad101
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Hotel Elysees Regencia at the end of June and loved it. Everyone from the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were very nice and spacious. I did alot of research on Tripadvisor prior to picking this hotel and the reviews were right on. If you're looking for a nice hotel, friendly staff and a great location then don't look any further.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: JVEAntwerp
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff in a quit hotel on a central location. Bicycles can be rented on the doorstep. Breakfast is quit good quality.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great choice for a romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: travelbyair777
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write this review for a while as this hotel went beyond what was required to make our stay very comfortable and memorable. I was scheduled to arrive early (like 7am) on a red eye and had emailed the hotel ahead of time asking for (very) early check-in. They said they couldn't guarantee anything unless I booked for an additional day, which is fair enough. When I got to the hotel, which is conveniently located about a block and a half from the Metro, I was very pleasantly surprised that my room was ready and accessible to me at no extra charge! I had booked the romance package, which sounds a bit cheesy, but I liked the idea of a bottle of champagne to kick off the weekend properly. The staff was very thoughtful in asking me when I would like it delivered to the room, and they kindly dealt with my changing my mind a couple times. They delivered it when we were out, and we came back to a cold bottle of bubbly, candles, and rose petals. Very nice. The staff was also instrumental in keeping us well fed throughout the weekend. We hadn't made any reservations and changed up our dinner plans a number of times. The front desk called up multiple restaurants for us and dealt with all the changes. One night, we opted for late-night room service, and hotel staff informed us that the menu item we were trying to order was not available because of the late hour. We placed an order for something else, but he called back in a couple minutes and said that he had found a way to get us the food from a nearby restaurant! The hotel itself is very nicely decorated, and our (deluxe) room was clean, modern, and spacious. However, it's the great experience with the staff that will make me book again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mvgp
Reviews.Content: perfect location, excellent breakfast, helpful staff. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location and superb staff”
Reviews.Author: bxlcpl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends and the location was wonderful and felt very safe. The staff were always very polite, professional and helpful. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were clean. Would absolutely stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bpoffen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very modern and decorated tastefully. The location was close to the Arc d'triumphe and Eiffel Tower but not in a too touristy area. Relatively large rooms for Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Pneguin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights the week before Easter. Not the cheapest hotel available but not the most expensive either. We were so pleased with our choice and viewed it as good value. The hotel is very well situated - just a few minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees and a pleasant 15 - 20 minute walk from Eiffel tower. It's also quite close to the metro (George V nearest). We travelled on Eurostar and then took RER and metro into the hotel for about £2.50 for both of us - a fraction of the cost of a taxi and quite easy to navigate. Just be prepared to navigate a couple of staircases with your case or look around for a lift! Anyway,back to the hotel. Small, very quiet despite central location and it is beautifully appointed and very well maintained. Our bed was extremely comfortable, the room whilst not large had everything we needed and the bathroom included Hansgrohe shower and fittings, dressing gowns,slippers etc. The service is extremely efficient, friendly and unobtrusive. The staff don't go out of their way to be your new best friend, but they are more than happy to help and advise. We had a breakfast inclusive deal which worked out well. The breakfast room was never busy (possibly due to the standard 19 euro charge which is not good value compared to nearby cafes) but the food selection and quality was very good, again attentive service including endless coffee refills. A relaxed, leisurely breakfast here was a great way to prepare for a hectic day's sightseeing. We would not hesitate to use the Elysees Regencia again if and when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: missyu16
Reviews.Content: I searched for months on Trip Advisor on which hotel to stay at in Paris. There are many hotels that don't accomodate 'families.' We travled with my son and this was the perfect hotel. The location of the hotel was perfect! An easy walk to Champs Elysees, and the other direction, an easy walk to the RER. The staff was so accomodating, especially Ali. The breakfast is so worth it! The next time we go back to Paris, we definitely will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JoeNamathsLiver
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regencia has one of the best staffs I have stayed with. The hotel is very nice and clean. They are located one block over from the Champs de Elysees and are surrounded with a nice variety of restaurants. Easy walk to shopping, Arch de Triomph, Eiffel Tower and Metro & RER trains to Verssailes and Galleries Lafayette. The location is excellent without breaking the bank. It is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: firebirdgirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Elysees Regencia was a great mix of modern chic and French class. The rooms are about what you’d expect for France – beautiful yet cozy. The bed was beyond comfortable and the floors, headboard, and other furniture in the room were exactly what I want in my own home if I had a few thousand to blow at Crate and Barrel. We chose this hotel for the first leg of our honeymoon due to other reviews on Tripadvisor. At best, I can offer my review as "eh...." The bathrooms boasted a toilet and bidet, had plenty of space inside and on the counter, and the shower was nice and hot. However, the shower head was awkwardly placed, which made the shower seem tiny. The staff placed rose petals in our bathroom prior to our arrival which was a nice touch. I assume it was because we were there for our honeymoon. Co-workers sent over a bottle of champagne (the real deal!) and fruit as a honeymoon gift, which was beautifully set up by the staff. The staff was helpful and spoke English very well. However, no one really went out of their way to make us feel like we were in a high-end hotel. I've gotten better service at a Comfort Inn. Breakfast was available each morning for 20 Euro, but we never tried it with so many other affordable cafes nearby. Other than the bedding, the best thing about the about the hotel was its location, with the Eiffel Tower only a 15-20 minute leisurely walk from the hotel and the other major sites and shopping only a 5 to 10 minute cab ride away. We very much enjoyed our stay in Paris. We understand the high price given the amenities and location, but do not understand the price given the service and lack of personality of the staff. I’m not sure we’d stay here again with so many other options in the city.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING & FLAWLESS!”
Reviews.Author: IVK247
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Elysees Regencia. The hotel has the perfect location to discover Paris. In just 5 minutes walk you find the famous Champs-Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe. Also near to subway (4mins) so you can explore Paris Very Easily! Our room was very comfortable and modern. The room was made twice per day. Nothing is lacking: towels were replaced, shower gel and shampoo were replenished and evenings there is a little chocolate before going to bed. The bath products "Occitane" of essential oils smell wonderful! The reception staff was very friendly, they have recommended excellent restaurants! Furthermore, they also told us what you can do in the vicinity of the hotel! Thank you to all the team! We had an unforgettable weekend! Definitely Would Come Back Again

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay With Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: girlslove2travel
Reviews.Content: I took my 13 year old daughter and her friend to Paris for a long weekend and decided to try this hotel based on the previous reviews I read on Trip Advisor. I have to say the reviews were right on target. The rooms were spotless and had all the amenities one could possibly need. The staff at the hotel go out of their way to accomodate requests and are very helpful with restaurant recommendations as well as information on getting around via the metro. We had breakfast included in our hotel rate and the selection and food were very good. The service and staff at breakfast were also excellent. We had stayed at the Four Seasons on our last trip and really loved our stay there but we will definitely save money and stay at this hotel on our next trip to Paris over the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was excellent !!!”
Reviews.Author: Juliejoo
Reviews.Content: I and my husband stayed in this hotel for 10 days last December 2010. The location was perfect, room was very clean, front desk service was very helpful. Also, we liked breakfast very much, food was good, the area atmosphere was very cozy. Everything was excellent!!! I will recommend this hotel to my friend.

Reviews.Title: “An extra ordinary visit to Paris, thanks to Hotel Elysees Regencia”
Reviews.Author: mikeislay
Reviews.Content: My mother and I have always wanted to explore Paris and the many grand excursions the city has to offer. After surfing through a number of hotel websites with reviews I finally booked our holiday with the hotel Elysees Regencia. The most appealing reviews from other guests being the cleanliness and location of the hotel, we rated both these aspects ***** five stars. Being South Africans, this was a once in a lifetime journey and I wanted it to be perfect. We had a rather large list of things to do, but had no idea how we were going to fit it all in seven days. I contacted a lady named Olympe at the hotel concierge who had dealt with our hotel booking and asked if she could help us with advice on our tour plan. She confirmed that the hotel worked hand in hand with accredited tour operators and assured me that I could leave our tour plan in her hands. Clearly the best choice. We felt much safer knowing that my card details and dealings were with one party on the many excursions. It was also an additional safety feature that the Hotel knew our daily whereabouts. This was definitely one of the best holiday's for my mother an I. Thank You Hotel Elysees Regencia and Staff

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: FutureNYC
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Paris I had a truly unforgettable 2 nights at the Hotel Elysses Regencia. My husband had booked the trip for my birthday and had arranged for the room to be set up for our arrival with champagne, chocolates, music and rose petals on the bed. I was 5 months pregnant at the time so needless to say when I walked in and saw what they had done I was in tears, it was beautiful. The staff were excellent, very helpful and knowledgeable and were very accommodating when we requested a late check out. They also helped in organising transport of an evening and to/from the airport. The breakfast provided is great with an excellent selection of pastries, cereals, cheese/meats, bacon, eggs, sausages, pancakes, fruit, yoghurt, juices etc. It was a help yourself set up, although there was a member of staff on hand who offered tea/coffee/made sure everything was stocked up. We had more than enough choice to see us through the day of walking around Paris. The location is great, we choose to walk to most things as it was nice to take a leisurely stroll and take in the sights although there is a subway station very close by. The rooms at the hotel are lovely, nice size, quiet, clean and room service is available (highly recommend the chocolate cake). We would definitely use this hotel again if staying in Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: loveluxury
Reviews.Content: Good location a few mins walk from Champs d'Elysees. Got upgraded on arrival which was a pleasant surprise. Small hotel, not much atmosphere in bar area which was empty on all occasions we were near it. Room overlooked the main road but noise wasn't a problem and beds very comfortable. Toiletries were good quality although not all were replensished. Reception staff were excellent and made us a reservation for dinner, called taxi etc and were always courteous and professional. My only complaint would be €6 for a bottle of orange from the mini-bar which I thought was on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: danyelle1986
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The hotel itself is located on a tree lined avenue, literally 2mins walk to the Champs Elysee and Arc de Triomphe. The rooms are quite spacious for a central hotel and have everything you need for a short break, as well as a few extras, such as complimentary chocolates from the local patisserie. We ate out mostly so cannot comment on the food, but we did have continental breakfast delivered which was very nice and always brought to the room on time. We booked via the hotel website and got quite a good deal at around £190/night, which isn't too bad for Paris. The staff were very friendly and always helpful which added to the charm of the hotel. Also loved the Parisian decor throughout. If returning to Paris, I probably wouldn't stay anywhere else, had a brilliant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: evanscm3
Reviews.Content: Finding 'good value' in Paris is difficult at the best of times. Hotels are no exception. This hotel, though on the 'compact' size is, however, one of the few things in Paris that is not awful value for money. The rooms are smart and clean and the service was excellent. We didn't sample the bar (and breakfast was not included) but the front desk were very friendly and knowlegable. Location is perfect for Champs Elysees and Arc d.T. There are lots of very good hotels in Paris, but for the price this one is a very good mid-ranger.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful service and very clean”
Reviews.Author: October212010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Elysees Regencia for 5 nights in late October 2010. Right from the start the concierge was friendly and helpful. The hotel is in an ideal central location. It is a short (approximately five minutes) walk to Champs Elysees, the Arc de Triomphe, train station, and cruise terminals for the river Seine. Most major attractions are also close by and can be reached by walking. The Eiffel Tower is about 15 minute walk and the Louvre Museum is a beautiful 25 minute walk. Besides the great location, the staff were friendly and helpful. They managed to book us into a one star Michelin restaurant and a three star Michelin restaurant with short notice. The hotel staff also made other reservations for us. We were provided with useful information which made our stay much easier and more enjoyable. I would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to returning to Paris and stay at the same hotel. This hotel is close to many eating places for all price range. The hotel is very clean and towels and sheets are of high quality. The products provided were also very good. In short, for us Elysees Regencia hotel was an excellent find that made our trip easier and more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: Carole75
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in an excellent location. Beautifully furnished and very clean. Good quality toiletries by L'Occitane, big towels, fluffy bath robes, very comfortable beds with lovely linens, high quality fittings in the bathroom, free and fast wifi. We loved the plate of the Parisian speciality macaroons in our room on arrival. The staff were friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a deluxe room which was a nice suprise; but it wasn't huge so I think the regular rooms must be pretty small. We like the toilet being separate from the bathroom. The over bath shower was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gloria S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location close to the Siene, Eiffel Tower and many other attractions. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was an excellent size, I think we may have had the deluxe room. The toilet was separate to the bathroom which is great although the toilet was very small. Breakfast was not included in our price we did decide to eat there one morning but felt it did not reflect the hotel and it was expensive for what was available. Internet was free, which is always a bonus. Each evening our bed was folded down with a chocolate on the pillow, such a nice touch. Rooms were very quiet to sleep. We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and would definately stay here again and recommend it to friends. We also felt it was easier to flag your own taxi in this area as from the hotel they took there time. Our experience of taxi drivers in Paris was not good.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, solid value”
Reviews.Author: TNbraindoc
Reviews.Content: We chose this property solely due to Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed. Location is convenient to Champs Elysses, Eiffel Tower and other major sites. However it is fairly quiet and peaceful inside. Staff was helpful and service was attentive. Rooms are small but very adequate. Bathrooms were much nicer than most we've seen in Europe. Would highly recommend for value and location.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel can make the trip!”
Reviews.Author: maryjanekca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been in many hotels touted for great customer service but the Elysees Regencia is in a class by itself. The entire staff devotes itself to making every aspect of your stay perfect. The ideal location, the intimate feel of the hotel, a gorgeous breakfast all added to a Paris vacation that one dreams about but rarely if ever finds. The fact that it doesn't break the bank to do so only adds to the list of attributes. Also to be noted is the staff speak perfect English but the hotel is as Parisian as one could hope for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: rnuge10
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights last week, traveling with another couple. The location was great, walking distance to many attractions. The room was tiny for the price, but it was clean and quiet. The other couple we were with had a Superior room, and it was quite a bit larger than the standard room we had. Staff was friendly and helpful and public areas clean and attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great staff, will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: JoyN_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had one night in Paris and choose to stay at Elysees Regencia. From the moment we arrived the service was amazing. The staff spoke english, were welcoming and very friendly. The room was spacious and all fixtures and furnishings of the highest standard. I felt as if I was in a very luxurious hotel even though I was paying a reasonable price. The staff made us feel so welcome and were so friendly and helpful. They also communicated with my daughter to organise a special birthday surprise from Australia. Thank you so much to all the staff for making our stay so wonderful. We will be recommending you to others and we do hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: junebug0605
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time to stay at this hotel and again it was wonderful. The staff was simply amazing. They helped us with restaurant recommendations, directions, metro help, etc. The rooms were great. We had one regular room and then a suite for the family of 3. The hotel is easily accessible to a lot of different things. ( Champs Elysees, Arc de Triomphe, the river, Eiffel Tower, the Louvre) It was a wonderful vacations. The hotel does have A/C and that helps with the summer temps. Beds were very comfortable. The mini bar was good. The macaroons in the room upon arriving are a special treat! We can't wait to get back to Paris and be able to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to visit Paris again!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Velodramatic
Reviews.Content: -Found this hotel via Tripadvisor. Booking online was easy. -Friendly staff and Great location - close to Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees, & ~35 min walk to Louvre. Lots of cafes nearby, including one adjacent to hotel. -Modern and clean decor is very pleasing. Nice linen, towels, and robes made the hotel experience very luxurious. AC helped with the summer humidity. Turn down service for the last two evenings was a delight. -Breakfast buffet is one of the best that I've experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Gourmet Cycling Travel's 2010 Tour de France trip finale.”
Reviews.Author: GourmetCyclingTravel
Reviews.Content: Our cycling guests were thrilled with the Hotel Regencia. The rooms are modern, stylish and spacious (for Parisian standards!). There is no restaurant, but hey, we're in Paris after-all and there is no shortage of great places to eat. The breakfast was fresh, delicious and full of variety. The majority of the staff were very pleasant and helpful and all spoke English quite well. The best feature of the hotel is it's location! Located directly between the Champs-Élysées and the river Seine, it is only a stones throw from great shopping and the Eiffel tower. For us it was ideal as a home-base for celebrating the Tour de France Arrival as they loop through the streets of Paris! A definite gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Ryguy22x
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel accesible to many attractions. Quick taxi ride to the Eiffel Tower. 3 block walk to the Champs Elysees. Small room, but what do you expect in Paris. The beds were comfortable, we wantedd to take the pillows home with us. While in Paris visit the Rodin Museum amongst all the many other sights...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great amenities- and a pretty great $$ to boot for Paris.”
Reviews.Author: mrsgodzilla
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based soley on the reviews found here, and am so happy to say that it was a great choice! Searching for a good/great hotel in Paris that won't cost a fortune? You've found it. My French is terrible, but the staff spoke great English and were polite, accomodating and friendly. The room (I got a sage green one) was quite spacious for Euro standards, with a seating area near the window perfect for two. The linens were soft and plush, and the bed was super comfy. (Bonus- room has AC!) The bathroom (also a good size) was always stocked with perks (fluffy towels, LeOccitane soaps & personal items) with great water pressure and plenty of hot water. The location (a few blocks away from the Arc d'Triomphe) had great subway access (George V on the 1 is the closest) and was centrally located without being smack in the middle of everything. Overall a great choice at a great price. I'd even tell my Mom to stay here, and she's super picky. It's a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: rumtraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Elysees Regancia in April. On arrival we were upgraded to a superior room. It was lovely room, very clean with nice toileteries, bath robes etc and a view of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is within walking distance to most places and the metro is nearby. Cannot comment on breakfast as we did not have any in the hotel. The staff were brillant, I can honestly say I have never stayed in a hotel where the staff were so nice. They went out of their way to help you have an enjoyable stay. We took the train from the airport to paris which we worried about as we have very little French, but we had no problems. The only thing we found that their were a few beggars on the train looking for money, if you ignore them they will not bother you. Overall we had a great stay in Paris and would recommend this hotel very much. A big thank you to all the staff at the Hotel Elysees Regencia for making our time in Paris very special

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, and well-situated”
Reviews.Author: Dekard
Reviews.Content: Spent four fabulous days here in May. It is a very smart, clean, and well-situated hotel, near to the Arc de Triumph and the Champs Elysee. Ave de Marceau is quite a busy cobbled road so a bit noisy if your room is on the front and you have your window open. The air con wasn't on for the first night and we sweated a bit. However, the next day the friendly staff were happy to switch it on centrally. Not very powerful however, so I don't know how effective it would be on a really hot day - perhaps they have a variable central control, and it was on its lower settings. Room was very stylish and clean and the bed was comfortable. Free Wi Fi. Staff are absolutely lovely. Breakfast at 19 euros was a bit steep, so we didn't bother. There's a nice cafe next door. There's also a good Lebanese (chain) restaurant, Noura, 100yds south down the Ave Marceau, which was appreciated by my vegetarian wife, and for which we didn't need to reserve a table. After our last trip to Paris, when we had a taxi ride to the airport at 70+mph, 3 feet behind the vehicle in front, whlie the driver was on his mobile phone (ARGHHHH!), we decided to use the Metro to get from the Gare du Nord, but it was a bit of a slog (Parisians are not into escalators, which may explain why there were so few obese people compared to England or the USA!). Therefore got a taxi back, but the heavy traffic prevented a white-knuckle ride. We adore Paris, and this Hotel did it proud.

Reviews.Title: “A superb boutique hotel in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: APTB21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a deluxe room which was spacious, well furnished with very comfortable beds. The buffet breakfast was good but the hot option which consisted of scrambled eggs, sausages and bacon was luke warm We had a very relaxing stay and the staff were always polite and only too happy to help with restaurant reservations and provide information on places to visit Will definitely return to this hotel on my next visit to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Four stars and well located...”
Reviews.Author: richardr38
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as the TripAdvisor reviews were good and we wanted some 'luxe' for a night. The room was large and well-appointed with first class bedding. A well-equipped spacious bathroom. The front desk staff were friendly, helpful and very good at finding us a nice fish restaurant on a busy Saturday night. The location on Avenue Marceau places it near many of the finest specialty stores and places of interest, and the Metro is nearby. I travel to Paris on business and would definitely consider it for this purpose too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Close to Everything You Would Want!”
Reviews.Author: travelguyky
Reviews.Content: A wonderful, wonderful hotel. My wife and I spent 15 days here May of 2009 and it was the kind of hotel that we will never forget! Got a great discount for reserving 30 days out! Every front desk receptionist spoke perfect English and was a concierege for our planning. The hotel is located within walking distance to four seperate Metro stops. We took the downhill walk each time; the Ave. Marceau station to start our site seeing, then returning by way of the Kleber station each evening. Having a G20 grocery store within 300 meteres as well as laundry, bakery, wine and confectionary made for fun shopping and gave us the chance feel like a local. Wi-fi in the room was excellent and our superior room's adjacent bath was spacious. The hotel restaurant was refined and included enough food for an American to call it a "buffet." The rooms are European in that there are not cabinets and bureaus in the room to store clothes. The maid service was exceptional. That chocolate next to the turned-down sheet each night was a very welcome after a long day of sightseeing! Could not more strongly recommend a place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: KG11-Paris
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and I was a bit nervous because my French isn't great. The team at Regencia gladly accommodated me and spoke English very well. Next were the rooms...very nice quality. They were very comfortable and quite stylish. Finally, the location couldn't be better. A short walk to the Arc d'Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience at Elysees Regencia”
Reviews.Author: AK0027
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about our stay at Hotel Elysees Regencia. My husband and I were traveling with another couple, and both of our rooms were spotlessly clean, well appointed, quiet, and comfortable. There was a guest computer with free internet access in the lobby and the location was unbeatable- less than a 5 min walk to the Champs Elysees. My only complaint was that some of the front desk staff were not particularly helpful when asking for restaurant recommendations, etc, and there is no concierge service. Overall, however, our stay was a great experience, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull trip”
Reviews.Author: jelenkomedenko
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here . The hotel was really lovely.One of the advantages is good location. Hotel is located near champs elysees. There are shops and cafes nearby and a lovely restaurant just up the street. The next thing which was wonderfull is staff. They were very profesional and pleasant.I felt at home. Rooms are big and clean.Breakfast was excellent, they offer different types of cuisine.I can say to everyone that should visit this hotel because I have never been on better hotel in Paris.i am sure that I will come again. My score is 5 ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Great Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: CazNorthumberlandUK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were travelling to Lyon for a meeting and decided to have 2 days in Paris. I booked the Elysees Regencia because of the reviews on trip advisor. We were not disappointed. Great location although on a bit of a hill (not for the infirm). Room was lush and the most comfy bed ever! Staff were so nice and could not do enough for us. We did not eat in the hotel as there were plenty of restaurants around. Overall we enjoyed our short stay. We have always believed that the French were not friendly but we found everyone to be most helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mpale
Reviews.Content: I had a fabulous stay at this hotel! I arrived early Friday morning, and although check-in was at 2pm, my room was ready for me at 11am. The hotel personnel couldn’t have been more helpful, courteous, informative, efficient, and pleasant. I was nervous about not speaking French, but they spoke perfect English, welcomed me, and assisted me with restaurant recommendations, sites to visit, and how to travel in Paris. My room was spotless, very comfortable and cozy. I loved my fuchsia-colored room which provided a boutique-y atmosphere and upscale environment. Everything was superbly comfortable. The hotel itself is in a terrific location in the heart of the Paris’ "Golden Triangle", right near the Champs Elysees, Arc de Triomphe, and the Eiffel Tower. I have stayed in many four and five star hotels in Europe, and the Hotel Elysees Regencia did not disappoint. On a final note, the clock was moved forward an hour for daylight savings time, and I missed check-out on Sunday which was at noon. A call to the front desk, and they immediately extended my stay for a couple of hours without charge. A fabulous ending...c’est magnifique! Merci beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “parisian elegance”
Reviews.Author: JPMNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: my husband organised a surprise visit to paris last weekend for my birthday (almost didnt get there due to passport office dispute in dublin) but so glad we made it! had an absolutely wonderful time and the hotel was perfect - great location, very comfortable, helpful and friendly staff, lovely breakfast selection, beautiful building with lovely wrought iron balconies overlooking the street - couldnt fault it in any way. Paris is such a wonderful elegent exciting city - only thing was everything was so expensive!! but would love to go back again and again. Thank you to everyone at Hotel Elysees Regencia for your courtesy and helpfulness.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shop4fun
Reviews.Content: This was a cute and conveniently located boutique hotel. It's within quite a few blocks walking distance of great shopping, food, and public transportation on the Avenue des Champs Elysees. The staff was a little stand-offish, but responsive if something was needed. We stayed there on two different legs of our trip - the beginning and the end (we also traveled to other cities in the region). The first room was cramped but cute. It was also a bit noisy because it was located near the stairs and elevator. The second room was larger, spacious and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: vra303
Reviews.Content: After a few very disappointing business hotels in Paris (paying up to 350 euros for incredibly bad rooms), I wasn't expecting much this time. However, I was pleasantly surprised by everything that Hotel Elysees Regencia delivered, from the convenience (5 minutes' walk to the Champs Elysees) to the room decor to the comfort of the mattress to the smile on the staff's faces. It makes business trips a lot more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Epitomised!”
Reviews.Author: wizardofozMelbourne
Reviews.Content: After Forty years of wishfull thinking my wife and I celebrated our Anniversary in Paris. We stayed two weeks with a weekend break in London. We chose the Regencia based on Trip Advisor reviews. How lucky/fortunate can you get? All the staff were beyond belief when it came to making us feel welcome and more importantly, at home! Service levels ie. assistance with any request, eg directions, cabs, tours, restaurant suggestions, general French language skills/translations etc was exemplary. Superbly located between the Arch, Champs, Tower and River (all under 10 minutes slow walk) and shopping, restaurants, cafes, convenience stores. Clean, Generous, and Fantastic Staff , Value for Money, sum it up but we know that the overall experience is governed by the General Management (Laetatia Lafosse) and their implementation and control of highest Hospitality standards. We want/will to stay there again, no debate! The piano player, Sacha Menny (composer), was also extraordinary and typified Paris! Most highly recommended!! Congratulations on a task well done Hotel Regencia and Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: FreeTravelerBG
Reviews.Content: We - my wife and I, were in Paris 2 years ago. We knew what to expect from 3 * hotels in Paris, so we decided this tome to choose a 4 star hotel, even if it is more expensive. We Booked Elysees Regencia after reading the reviews of trip advisor. The hotel is ideally located in a very good area – a few minutes walk from Place D’Etoile and Arc de Triumph, a few minutes walk form Place del Alma, and a few minutes from Champs Elysees. The service at the hotel was just perfect. All the staff was extremely helpful and at the same time discrete enough. The room was cleaned two times in each day – at the moorning, and at the evening. Everything was just perfect – the rooms, the lobby, the breakfast – mmm… what a breakfast!- the location, the service. For that price this is definitely the best choice for a Hotel in Paris and this will be our hotel for every next stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: debelfast
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our honemoon in Paris. The hotel was really lovely, just as described on this website. I had read all the reviews here before booking and was really pleased with the service we received. The hotel is located quite near the Eiffel Tower and Champs Elysee and the area it is in is pretty quiet. There are shops and cafes nearby and a lovely restaurant just up the street. The hotel room we had was quite spacious and very well kept and the l'occitaine toiletries in the bathroom were a really nice touch. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, and although it is a bit more expensive than others, its well worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: eveenemean
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Friendly staff really helped us out alot with reservations, language, directions, even photos on my camera and using the computer. They also came to fix a clogged sink in about five minutes. Very good! The location was pretty good and was very close to most main attractions and also pretty close to a subway line for getting around other parts of the city. The rooms were very clean. Rooms were fairly roomy and nicely decorated. Very elegant and pretty. Only real downer was the price was a little more than we wanted to spend, but worth it in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: lafontaine30
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris twice so far and stayed here both times, it was fantastic. There was four of us and we were having a hard time using the Internet to find a hotel that supported four people, as we needed additional beds. At first their website recommended we get two adjoining rooms which ended up being outside of our budget, so I emailed them asking if there was anything else we could do since we were willing to cram into one room and sleep on a couch or floor if need be. I got a response in less than a day saying they would upgrade me from the standard double room to a deluxe double room and add two roll-out beds (sweet!) for just EUR35/each. I sent back the booking form no questions asked, as this option was more than half what other hotels wanted for either a suite or something else compatible. Upon arrival it was just as I remembered, friendly staff that spoke great English, awesome little hotel. Our room was also fantastic with very nice design, extremely clean, and L'Occitane amenities. Wifi was also free and the mini-fridge didn't charge you to take things out and look at them. My only note on this aspect is that I think food (specifically the breakfast) and the items in the fridge are high priced, more so than you would expect from a hotel, even fancy ones, in general. While we were out in evening the staff brought in the two additional beds. The completely rearranged the entire room and did a full turn-down service complete with chocolates which was cool. The fact that they made a lot of effort to properly arrange the room in a comfortable way to fit all the beds was really nice from a service standpoint. They also stocked us up with extra bath supplies and towels. The hotel is in a great location two avenues away from the Champs Elysees. It took us 5 minutes to get to the main avenue and 10 minutes to reach the Arc du Triomphe. Major metro lines are also close; Eiffel Tower was a 15 minute walk. The whole area is very nice and safe, and has a lot of shopping options. The bar at the hotel is small and was served by the door man which was cool. Drinks were a bit pricey but it was fun to relax in a small bar. I would recommend this hotel to virtually anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshine11650
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Paris where we stayed for one night in this hotel. The hotel had a very nice warm but modern feel about it with a nice lounge area. We had a standard room which was very comfortable with one of the most comfortable beds I have ever stayed in with again great decor. The breakfast room was in the basement and was nicely decorated and there was a great choice of food to choose from. The service and the location was great. We would definatley recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money, good location and gives more than they offer.”
Reviews.Author: milosjelkica
Reviews.Content: I was positively surprised comparing offers in Paris what I' ve got in this offer. If we compare any other hotel in this range there would not be a such place with marbles breakfast for just 19 euros, including everything from best ham's to nice lovely french bakery and cheeses. The regular room where I stayed was very spacious and nicely decorated. Must say that they take care on customers in every sense including free WiFi in hotel. Room service was very fast, professional and pleasant. Bathroom is very modern and stylish. All in all very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “All round Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FeargalDerry
Reviews.Content: I had seen this hotel while searching trip advisor for a central location for a three night stay in Paris. Prior to my arrival i contacted the concierge Pascal - Arthur who was extremely helpful and patient with my requests. I arranged numerous trips and extras (such as car transfer from airport to hotel; romance package in room etc.) all were excellent through the hotel. The rooms are very clean (twice daily) and of good size with everything you need. Staff very helpful and friendly. Free internet use was also a nice touch. The location was perfect, walking distance for all attrctions. From start to finish a great trip, one i will always remeber as i got engaged to my girlfriend. Other recommendations for trip would include Dinner cruise at night alont Siene and wine tasting through O'Chataeu.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Couples”
Reviews.Author: ConanTheCorkonian
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in great location. Very clean and modern. Rooms are just like in the pictures. Excellent service. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, large room for Paris and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: susieQandjacob2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in paris but took a two day trip to Normandy in the middle of it, so I took the opportunity to change hotels and experience both left bank and right bank settings. We stayed at the Hotel Odeon, on the left bank for the first part of our trip and then the elysees regencia when we returned from Normandy. STayed at the Hotel Churchill in Bayeux. Using tripadvisor recommendations on all, we were very, very pleased with our accomodations. The Odeon hotel room was very small and the lift was only large enough for two people, but it was clean and convenient and the service was wonderful. We were hardly in the room so size was not that big of a deal. It was also very, very quiet, on a side street near the L Odeon Opera, but very convenient to St. Michel and St. Germain and Odeon metro stops. We used the metro easily and walked a lot, of course. The Elysees Regencia, was much more luxurious, along the line of a 4 star hotel in states, and higher priced, but a larger room by far, and again, wonderful service. It was noisier in the morning, as closer to the main streets, but if you want to be in the ARch de triumph area, near shopping, etc, this is the place to stay! WE loved the little hotel churchill and quaint Bayeux as well, although there is no elevator there, so carrying bags up to the room was a little tough, as we packed way too much. Thankfully, my husband was able to handle that. I greatly appreciate tripadvisor!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find”
Reviews.Author: Constantlyontheroad
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I'm normally depressed and disappointed when I stay in hotels in Paris. They often still have a faint hint of smoke, there are cracks in the walls, burn marks or stains in the carpets, there's very little space and the beds are small, with two twin beds often pushed together and advertised as a double bed. This is all billed as "character" It also normally costs you €200-€400 per night for the privilege if you're on the rack rate. I searched for quite some time for a mid-range "boutique" alternative because I didn't fancy splashing out on the George V, the Maurice or Le Bristol when we were going to be spending most of our time in Paris at an event. I am so glad that we ended up at Elysees Regencia. The location was fantastic. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, the room was ready early (and we were given coffee while we were waiting for the paperwork to be completed), we were upgraded and they had free internet and printing in the lobby which was brilliant since I had stupidly lost our Eurostar tickets. The room was modern, well decorated, clean, relatively spacious (remember the competition here!) and good value for money. The bathroom could have been better (and bigger) but honestly, it's amongst the better ones I have seen in Paris. The water worked, there was decent shower pressure, etc. To me, this hotel is a Parisian gem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect as always”
Reviews.Author: ge4567
Reviews.Content: Second time that we spent our week end in Paris at Hotel Elysees Regencia. This hotel is just great : service, decoration, location. Everthing was perfect like our first stay there 2 years ago. Go there, you will not be disappointed and your stay in this beautiful city will be unforgettable !

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Ziggy238
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a delightful 2 night stay at this hotel. We stayed in a delux room and have been extremely satisfied with the service. The room was spacious and welcoming. Decor was modern and little touches some as chocolates, macaroons and rose petals made it even more special. All the staff were extremely helpful. We didn't try the room service as the price of the food seemed a bit high, given the choice of fine eateries around. I would definetly recommend to try two restaurants close by called Le Hide (cote de beuf and tart tatin are unmissable) and the Le Fine Gauges for one of the best steak tartares. Thanks again Elysees Regencia for a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: mitrakazad
Reviews.Content: fellow travelers, I Definitely urge you not to stay there. me and my sixteen year old met my elderly aunt in paris like we do every year.After five weeks of stay at the hotel I left and due to a receptionist by the name Pascal Arthurs reservation mistake my 90 year old aunt found herself homeless in Paris; I found the sevice nonexistant rooms dirty management uncooperative and price way high for what they offer. The only positive is that I met Xavier a staff member who is great I recommand they fire everyone else and just keep him.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Suites!”
Reviews.Author: B_TheWorldExlporer
Reviews.Content: In Janaury 2008 we spend two nights at this hotel on a weekend jaunt to Paris. We rented out the Lavander Suite and it was the largest hotel room I've evern been in. The bed was ultra comforable and has steps leading up to it. In the center of the bed room is a french tub and there's his and her sinks and an amazing shower. The room also included soaps from l'occitaine and 2 flat screen tvs a couch and a few desks. It was reasonably priced for the time of the year and we lucked out to have weather of about 55-60 degrees in mid January. My fiance and I loved Paris and our stay here. It's a great place for a honeymoon in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Ema1981
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and me stayed in this wonderful hotel for a very special weekend in August. It's been a great experience. First of all the hotel is very beautiful with coloured modern furnitures and situated in a wonderful position (right next to the Champs Elysees). The room was clean, very nice, green coloured, well decorated, furnished in a contemporary (but not cold) style. There was a bathroom very well decorated with marble furnitures and roses on the lavabo. Every night we found a chocolate candy on the pillow and the bed was so confortable. The staff was exceptionally kind and helpful. Everytime we needed something, they helped us with a nice smile on their face (not so common as we could expect) and their suggestions turned out to be really helpful. A romantic and luxury hotel you don't have to spend all your money to stay in. A special and unique experience we'll keep in our minds and hearts for a long long time. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerAFAP
Reviews.Content: Looking for a hotel in Paris was very very difficult. Reading a lot about terrible service or horrendous conditions made me weary of finding one. I read the reviews on Trip Advisor for the Regencia and decided to book the room based on the great reviews. I went to Paris on a romantic getaway and we had an amazing experience. The hotel was very clean and the staff exceptionally friendly and helpful. The room was gorgeous, everything was clean and we had a view of the street. The hotel is near the Arc and Champs Elysees but it is on a side street so you dont have to hear the loud noise. It was very quiet at night. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and will definitely book with this hotel when I return to Paris. Everything about it was great. This is the hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Loved Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Jnle
Reviews.Content: Our family of five, two children under age of five, stayed for four nights. We had the family deluxe rooms and they were PERFECT. The staff was exceptional, friendly and very accomodative to us. We also could not have asked for better location, right between Arc and Eiffel Tower. The hotel made the trip even better! Would stay there again and will be recommending to anyone we know travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: butchyLondon
Reviews.Content: due to the exchange rate paris is a expensive choice for us English at the moment. but if you are going to go you won't do much better than this hotel. clean, nice size room, great location and staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: erika2205
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend picked this hotel because of the tripadvisor reviews. It's in an excellent location, five minutes walk to Champs Elysees, eight minutes to the river, ten to Eiffel tower. They upgraded us to an executive room straight away, it was a very nice abiseed decoration. Comfortable big bed, enough space in the room, clean showers. A nice, romantic place. I recommend it for couples and for those who think location is very important. Also, the staff at the reception gave us great ideas where to go clubbing and to bars - both their recommendations turned out to be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “delightful friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: aust_traveller_9
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous find this delightful hotel was. Traditional French on the outside, and sleek contemporary on the inside. Fabulous friendly and helpful staff, spotlessly clean, large comfortable beds and beautiful modern bathrooms. It was within walking distance to everything but surprisingly quiet, even thought our bedroom looked out over a very pretty street. There is an excellent Lebanese Deli a block away that as well as traditional food also sells fresh berries, yoghurt and wine. We recommend a Paris museum pass to miss the queues and we thoroughly recommend this beautiful boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel by all means”
Reviews.Author: Fei26
Reviews.Content: Just 1 min. on foot from Champs Elysees, all the shops, cafes, metro, everything is just next to you! In a quiet street just 50 meters from Arc de Triomphe! The staff was incredible, very friendly, ready to assist you. The Blue Suite was just the perfect luxury room for Paris, the classic double was good too! At the last night one the bed legs broke and the management gave us a 50% off the rate because of the inconvenience that caused to us, and we didnt even ask for something like that! The breakfast is good, has all basics and even more, its price is ok if you consider that having just a coffee and a croissant in champs elyssees avenue would be the same money. The receptionist booked us a table in the Pompidou restaurant at the terrace, amazing experience and great view. The truth is that I do not totally trust the reviews I see and because I am very reluctant with hotels because I travel a lot and have seen a lot of things this is the first time I felt obliged to say how great this hotel was in terms of value/money also. I will be staying there from now on when in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: narnneal
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a 2 night stay here. The hotel is well situated near the Arc de Triomphe and the Seine. We had a room on the top floor with lovely views over the rooftops. It was wonderfully clean and comfortable with the little added luxuries like bathrobes and L'Occitane bath products which made it feel a whole lot more special. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I imagined...”
Reviews.Author: GoxyUnkas
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I spent only one evening at the hotel in February - but I can tell you that from now on - every stay in Paris will be at this hotel. I proposed to my wife during our short stay in Paris - and prior to our arrival I kindly asked the General Manager for a few favours to ensure our stay would be truly memorable. Not only were my wishes met - but they were surpassed and everything was perfect - room, atmosphere, location, staff... nothing could have been better. I am now planning a longer family holiday in Paris - and we will definitely be staying at the Elysees Regencia. This review might sound a little corny - but I really don't have anything negative to say... it was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique hotel in a good location...”
Reviews.Author: GRGMusic
Reviews.Content: Ideal hotel for exploring Paris located just a stones throw from the Arc de Triumph. Very nice cafe next door too for breakfast and lunch. Rooms are small but well equipped and the service is excellent. Macaroons and water complimentary on arrival is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent!”
Reviews.Author: Recovery007
Reviews.Content: This is a gem, perfect position, geat breakfasts, good price, fantastic staff!

Reviews.Title: “perfect small hotel in quiet elegant neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: yssey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week and loved it! The room was a bit small but perfectly thought out so that it had all amenities. Very clean. Very quiet. Great bed and linens, nice efficient bathroom, great light (faced a small street in the back of the hotel). Breakfast was delicious, served in a nice space, and the staff are helpful and gracious without being stuffy. Would definitely go back. One caveat - internet is very slow in the room. There is a fast, free computer and printer in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for our Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: DesignDiva24
Reviews.Content: After being married in Greece and spending two weeks there, I planned a surprise add on to our trip by staying 5 days in Paris. I did a lot of research on this hotel and the reviews (the good ones, which most of them are) are 100% on the money! This hotel was fantastic! When we arrived they had upgraded our room!!!!! And since it was already a surprise to my husband, it was now a great surprise to me too. The breakfast was so YUMMY and all the staff was so friendly. I asked a lot of questions while I was there and they always were very willing to help. I found there attention to detail to be supurb...yet not over the top. It was just right...everything they did was just right! Oh and the location...really couldn't be better! Next time we are in Paris, I already know where I will be staying :) LOVE LOVE LOVE this hotel... stop reading and just book it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful treat for my 30th.”
Reviews.Author: corbington
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night to celebrate my 30th Birthday. We found the hotel with great ease following the directions from the hotel website. On arrival the member of staff was extremely friendly, welcoming and helpful and provided us with a map of the city. The hotel is in a fantastic location a short walk for the Seine and the Champs Elysees, while still being far away enough to be quiet. The room was just about big enough but was lovely and stylish with a very large and very comfortable bed. We were lucky enough to even have one of the paris balconies where you could see the tip on the Eiffle Tower at night. The bathroom was luxurious and even had a seperate loo. We opted for the continental breakfast in bed which arrived exactly when we asked and was actually good value for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, delightful service, wonderful big room for 4”
Reviews.Author: 1PalmBeachGardens
Reviews.Content: We had the big blue room on the top floor. The air conditioning was great. Turn down service lovely. They made up the room with the fold out bed without having to be reminded. The room was a big suite with a sweet bathroom/tub/shower/wc/ and sink area. Easy walk to the metro on the champs elysees or down ave Marceau to the Seine or up to the arc de triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique”
Reviews.Author: Tayan
Reviews.Content: Ideally located along the premier grand boulevard of the city, this hotel was both classy and unassuming. Easily the most expensive hotel I've stayed at in Europe, the money did not go to waste. My wife couldn't have been happier enjoying the posh bathtub after a 7 hour flight from Chicago and 2 hour train ride from Brussels. I booked us the junior suite which had the comfiest bed sectioned off from the room by blue curtains. The shower was also the most amazing I've encountered with more nozzles than I could count on one hand. The room style was a sort of elegant French country and the lobby, while also very elegant. Breakfast in the medieval cellar was also a very unique experience with lots of fresh and yummy choices (my favorite meal of the day). Service was also wonderful - front desk staff spoke perfect English and were eager to help and the staff discretely setup champaign, candles, rose pedals, and music in the room while us newlyweds were away for dinner. Totally worth it if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: longislanddebbi
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect: right off of the Arc de Triomphe, a block away from the famed Champs-Elysees, and a block away from the River Seine and the Eiffel Tower. Set in a leafy neighborhood surrounded by restaurants, fruit markets, stores, patisseries, and embassies, the hotel is a small, boutique-type establishment with contemporary furnishings and six floors of rooms. The first floor offers a small bar area, a reception, and private lobby with complementary magazines and newspapers. When I arrived from the U.S. on an overnight flight, I hoped to get right into my room for a nap. The front desk manager offered me a seat in the quiet lobby and asked if I would like something to drink while I waited. Very quickly and efficiently I was brought a pot of hot tea to sip. While I had my tea, my room was readied and I was able to check in at 8 a.m. rather than the conventional 2 p.m. My quiet room overlooked a back street where I could open my windown and watch Parisians walking to work or listen to the nearby church bells. As the week turned warmer, I turned on the air conditioning. Nice, small gestures abounded. An array of rose petals were laid on the bathroom towels, lovely scented shampoo and bath gels awaited, and a cluster of delicious sandwich cookies tempted me in my room. Each morning, I had breakfast downstairs at the hotel's buffet. While some people complained about the 19 Euro price, I found the breakfast to be delicious and worth the cost. The servers were very friendly and remembered each morning that I preferred tea to coffee. My choices ran from scrambled eggs, bacon, and sausage, to cold meats, fresh pineapple and watermelon, cheeses, several fresh-squeezed juices, and an array of freshly-baked breads. The hotel staff are superb! After I checked in early Monday morning, the front desk manager called me in the afternoon to alert me to a fire safety test. Since I had been sleeping, I appreciated the call and knew not to change into clothes and leave the hotel in a rush. Each time you leave the hotel, they ask you to give them your room key. Everyone at the front desk gets to know you and remembers your name and room number. One night my daughter and I decided to return to a restaurant on the Left Bank but wanted to be sure it was open. Our front desk manager called the restaurant and arranged for a hard-to-get outside table reservation. Everyone was courteous, efficient, and kind. I highly recommend the hotel and will definitely be back next time I'm in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very good sleep”
Reviews.Author: aahk
Reviews.Content: The bed is so comfortable. The room is very very clean. They provide loccitane bathing gel and shampoo which I love it! The staff are very nice and help on everything. The room is in modern style, which is cool is Paris where many of them are in antique decoration. The shower is good, location is good, just 5 mins walk to LV main store and metro station. But the internet is not stable enough and a bit slow, and the variety of food for breakfast is not enough.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Diablo66
Reviews.Content: Thank you for making our stay in Paris as good as it was. We had just transferred from The Ritz and were expecting quite a big drop in service standards and the hotel in general. We were pleasantly surprised. We were greeted and welcomed very professionally. We had a room with a balcony overlooking Paris which was awesome! Overall this hotel was in many ways even better than The Ritz. I will definitely stay here whenever I am in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Hassle...Not a boutique hotel, owned by Westin”
Reviews.Author: Vstarr17
Reviews.Content: I visited the Hotel Elyees Regencia with my sisters for a girls-only holiday break. We had the pink room, which is a double but they added a cot to accomodate us. My overall opinion is that I would definitely NOT stay here again. Here is why: Cleaniness 1: The beds were clean with the exception of mine, sort of. There was a huge yellow stain on the bottom sheet. It probably was clean, but I was pretty put off by sleeping on stained sheets (expecially when we were paying 350 Euro a night). My sister had to get another sheet from housekeeping to put over the stain for me. Cleaniness 2: The towels smelled awful!!!! Again, I had to assume they were clean. However the detergent they use must be a mix of French Tide and cow poo- not joking! What is up with that??? (If you have stayed here also, please respond to this one because I'm really interested in hearing other people's thoughts), Random 1: The hotel tries to be green by making you put a card in a slot to turn any lights on. This includes toilet lights, shower room lights, overhead lights etc. Maybe my sisters and I are stupid (although we are 3 successful women with advanced degrees and credentials) but there were a couple lamps that neither of us could figure out how to turn off without just unplugging. Since we didnt want to be crawling around on our knees unplugging and re-plugging these lamps we just pulled the card out at night which turned off ALL lights. Which meant that when I woke at 3AM to go to the loo, I had to do it in the pitch black. I bruised my shin and ended up waking up my sisters with my "French". Hotel Staff 1: They seem polite and nice at first. However, they are not very helpful. One of the nights there were 2 random sketchy-looking men in the hotel lobby (I'm pretty sure they were NOT guests) playing the piano. They were hitting on my sisters and I as we searched for a restaurant on the lobby computer. They completely grossed us out and made us feel uncomfortable, being that we were 3 women by ourselves. The front-desk person watched this entire scenario unfold and did not say a word and let the men stay. Hotel Staff 2: As my sister noted in her previous review, both she and her husband got diagnosed with Swine Flu 2 days before we were to leave for Paris. Her 3 year old son also had a flu although was not tested for Swine. Therefore we were forced to move our trip 1 week later. We called the Hotel over 48 hours in advance to reschedule for 1 week later. They told my sister over the phone that they would discuss the situation with us when we checked in. Then they sent an email saying they would charge us 1 extra night as a cancellation fee. We figured this was open to discussion, especially since we were still staying at the hotel. When we checked out, they did indeed charge us an extra night (besides charging us the Suite rate when we were stuck in a converted triple). The front desk man said we did not cancel within 48 hours. When we said that we called to cancel, he admitted that we called within 48 answers, but the cancellation had to be in email. Our email correspondence was not within 48 hours. Then he said that even if he did go by the phone call, the cancellation policy was really 72 hours. Then he changed it to 5 days in advance since the suite is difficult to rebook. So in a timeframe of about 10 minutes we were told 4 different cancellation polices. When I asked if they had ever managed to book the suite that we were charged an extra day for, he refused to answer. I take that as an affirmative. Elevator: We were on the the 5th floor, and the elevator happened to break on the hottest day we were there. We had to use the staircase, which is a beautiful winding staircase. However, after walking up and down it several times, you start wishing it was just a regular staircase. I noticed another review about the being elevator broken. This must be a regular occurance here. Location: True, the hotel is within walkin distance of the Eiffel Tower and some other touristy locations (my sister was VERY excited about the proximity to Louis Vuitton and other shopping). However, this is not the hip area to stay with tons of restaurants and little shops. We had to take taxis to get to any decent restaurants for young crowds, and found that getting a taxi home was exceptionally difficult.
