Final thoughts: When the hotel charged my sister's credit card, we were shocked to discover this is actually an American hotel- a Westin. I travel a great deal with my job and am therefore a Diamond level Hilton member. Had we wanted to stay in an American hotel we would have stayed in the Hilton. We wanted a French Boutique and all we got was hassle. I am regretting the fact that I could have gotten us a free room at the Hilton with exceptional service, and lovely smelling towels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: getarounds
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days and nights in early June. Super location! If you walk 5 minutes north you are at the Arc and on Champs Elysees and if you walk 5 minutes south you are on the Seine with a wonderful view of the EiffelTower. It just couldn't be better. Close to 2 Metro stops especially the yellow line that takes you to the Louvre and the Marais area which we enjoyed exploring. Our room and bathroom were nice, and clean probably 3 star quality. A bit small but what isn't in Paris. With all the great sites we didn't spend that much time there anyway. We did not eat at the hotel as there were so many options close by. Next corner up was Josephinas for Cappuccino and Crossiants to start the day. We had a very nice dinner at the corner of the Champs and Marceau at a place named Casa Luca. Another great choice for dinner was on Ave, George V named de Vez. The staff was very good. They were attentive and always willing to offer assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Wants SWINE FLU visitors to stay here... STAY AWAY from it!”
Reviews.Author: roby151
Reviews.Content: IF you decide to stay at this hotel, MAKE sure you purchase travel insurance. I came down with the SWINE FLU during this recent epidemic. I had to postpone my trip with my sisters a week in order to even be able to fly. We called the hotel to postpone the trip 48 hours in advance to our expected arrival. We re-booked for the following week. After speding 3 nights there, upon checkout, we noticed they charged us an extra nights stay. We brought it to their attention and they said they changed their cancellation policy to 72hrs although on their website, it explictly says 48hrs. I had a doctors note with my diagnosis, which they didnt even want to look at. They would not let us leave the hotel without us paying for the extra night, and after we did pay the extra night, they would not call a taxi for us. All in all, they gave us a smaller room than the one originally booked but still charged us the small amount of money. It was clean, although the staff was a bit stuffy, always turned thier noses up at ALL their guests. I would not stay here again due to the fact that they wanted me to stay there even with the swine flu. The airlines allowed me to rebook my tickets without any additional fees, other hotels I have called would have also allowed me to change travel plans given the swine flu dianosis. I would stay far away from this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marijana5
Reviews.Content: All the comments from previous guests were true.Hotel is wonderful, service is excellent, staff is very polite and always willing to help and provide information. Location of the hotel is great - in one word it is close to everything. Rooms are, for Paris, very good and provided with all necessary things. We were staying in standard room and I can say that even this room is very wide and provided with all the things that you might need and even more :) So as summary, it is a good value for the money, hotel is new, and location is super. Once again I need to emphasize the good sevice of the hotel staff, because they helped me a lot before we arrive in hotel and of course during our stay they were always on our disposal.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel - definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Bristol1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 days over the May bank holiday weekend. I can't recommend it highly enough. The staff were fantastically helpful and friendly and spoke amazing English. They made us feel really welcome and like very valued guests. The location is great, it's 5 mins from the Champs Elysees/nearest metro stop, and yet it's on a very quiet and peaceful street. We went for the cheapest room but i was very impressed with it. It was smart, clean, well designed and had all the nice touches that you would expect from a 4 star hotel. It wasn't massive, but nothing in Paris is and it was plenty big enough for myself and my boyfriend. The bathroom was lovely and a very good size and the bed was really comfy. The hotel helped make this a really amazing trip and i wouldn't hesistate to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: xplorer37
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Reasonable sized rooms and bathroom, large for Paris. Location is very convenient for Arch and for river cruises. Metro is 3 blocks away in 2 directions. Staff was very helpful. Arrived early on Sat morning and they let us check in. After long flight this made our arrival day a lot nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PeteandNic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Regencia in Paris for a 3 day break in late May 2009 for a special birthday celebration. The hotel is ideally situated in a quieter street adjacent to the Champs Elysees, and only a 5 minute walk from the River Seine. We reserved a blue junior suite, which was situated on the top floor of the hotel. The room was very spacious, especially by Parisian standards, comprising comfortable bed (2 singles pushed together), a large seating area, and the well appointed bathroom comprising his and hers vanity units, a separate WC, shower and corner bath. Complementary branded toiletries are included, as are tea and coffee making facilities (not all Paris hotels have this..). Included within our room rate was an excellent continental breakfast which was taken in the intimate, cosy basement restaurant. The hotel staff are all excellent, and managed to recommend a superb restaurant overlooking the Eiffel Tower (Cafe de l'homme at the Trocadero). If you are visiting Paris, and are not on a tight budget, you will not go far wrong with this hotel. We would not hesitate to stay here again, or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Me and my wife may.09”
Reviews.Author: therawas
Reviews.Content: The successfully meat my expectation especially when adhering to my special requests. And most significant advantage they have are their great staff where they did an excellent job in making us feel comfortable Tips: 1. Transportation from and to airport 2. More (English) channels on the TV

Reviews.Title: “Thank u Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: NYC67
Reviews.Content: We use tripadvisor every time we travel abroad and in the state. This place is perfect. Location, service and price r what we seek and this place is brilliant. We will without a doubt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMartin36
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a three day stay at the Hotel Elysees Regencia. The location is perfect. The hotel is tastefully decorated and well maintained. The rooms are comfortable, with a lovely bathroom and complementary l'occitane toiletries. The staff are friendly and very helpful. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and would definitely stay there again if I returned to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant, tasteful hotel ideally situated with polite and efficient staff.”
Reviews.Author: travellerbelfast_8
Reviews.Content: A perfect littlr hotel with a touch of class. I was disappointed to read one or two reviews that were un complimentary. I have travellen widely across Europe and North America and this hotel rates among the best. A little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seminole_kev
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight on a side trip to Paris and what a great hotel. Very friendly/helpful staff and the rooms are really great. Stylish, but very comfortable at the same time. Made for a great stay. We'd highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we ever stayed at. This is how we envisioned a Paris hotel to be!”
Reviews.Author: jbassman
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! The staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. We were in a superior room and had street views. The room was very comfortable with 2 french doors that had those mini-balconies. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone to stay at and would definitely book this place again next time I go.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teacher57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elysees at the end of March for our dughter's 21st. The hotel is particularly well placed for getting around Paris, only a short walk from the Seine and then in the other direction to Champs Elysees. All the staff were helpful, polite and treated us as honoured guests, especially Pascal. We were given two rooms next door to each other, with a door in the corridor to close us off from the rest of the hotel, almost like a mini suite. Great idea. The rooms were clean, spacious and beautifully decorated. We could not fault the hotel, although we did not sample their breakfast, 19 euros each. We would recommend this htel to anyone visiting PAris as an absolute find. A note about Paris in general! VERY expensive. Taxis are a rip off as they charge extra if you have more than two people in them. Had a lunch of 4 sandwhiches and 4 drinks near Notre Dame and it came to £96!!!! Couldn't believe it. We didn't stick to the main places, but went to local restaurants etc, still horrendously exspensive. The total bill for the weekend was quite a shock for 4 people. Won't be returning to PAris in a hurry because of this, not because of the hotel. If we ever did return it would be to The Elysees Regencia without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “The extra money goes a long way at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: brlyons
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the hotel elysees regencia in paris for our honeymoon. The rooms are very clean with a modern classy look. Excellent view from the French windows out onto the street below. The desk service was impressive and made every effort to ask if anything could be done for us and if we needed to know how to go somewhere being that we were unfamiliar with the area. It's a great location near a pricey area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice!”
Reviews.Author: travelinstyleManila
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regencia for 7 days, I was apprehensive at first but chose it based on reviews from Trip Advisor. I am glad that I opted for this hotel. Its along A. Marceau, near the A.Marceau and George V. Metro Stops. Hermes and Louis Vuitton shops are a few corners away, so for those who are in Paris for shopping, this is an ideal location for you. There is a mini-supermarche, pharmacie behind the hotel along rue de challiot, and a neighborhood french restaurant that have reasonably priced menus. If you are craving for Asian "take away", there is a store right behind the hotel. A bonus too is the St. Pierre de Challiot church where one can hear Catholic Mass. The staff were friendly and accommodating. I was given a room on the fifth floor, with a balcony. Plus, the hotel provides FREE Wifi Access.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better but good location...”
Reviews.Author: HoustonDaveB
Reviews.Content: I booked the room based on the reviews here so wanted to provide some feedback for other travellers. We stayed in one of the suites for a 3 day break as a special occasion. Having stayed in Paris before we know what to expect from a typical room and comfort levels etc. The room was fine, but the bed was nothing more than two singles pushed together and not as expected. The bed mattress was like wood, the linen and pillows were well below the level needed for a 400 Euro per night room. It wasn't a surprise that the walls were 'paper-thin' as per other Hotels I have stayed in Paris. The internet although free, was slow and unreliable so if you are here on business, I would not rely on it. The staff were excellent and not as per some other review - they were very helpful throughout the stay and the breakfast was pretty good although not sure 19 Euros is good value. We ordered a massage each which was very good although they do them in the same place as breakfast is served so not available all day. Overall, for the price, there are other places to stay which offer better value and comfort levels.

Reviews.Title: “Regencia Paris was ok -”
Reviews.Author: BluetoothBuda
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on March 23, 2009. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean (the bed was quite possibly the firmest that I have ever slept on). We paid 20 Euros more for this room than the rate I confirmed on the hotel's website (Total room cost was 275 Euros). I booked the room on the hotel's website at 255 Euros, however, when we arrived to check in, the guy at the front desk told me that since two people were staying in the room, that I would have to pay 275 Euros. This was somewhat frustrating - to say the least. Especially considering the fact that the hotel's website would not allow me to select two guests for the room (it was a superior room with two twin beds pushed together for two people). Green - we were impressed with (what we thought) was the hotel's energy saving system (you have to put your room key in a slot in the wall to turn the lights on - and when you pull the key out of the slot to leave your room, the lights turn off). The hotel did not have dual flush toilets - which we saw everywhere in France (perhaps one day these dual flushers will make it to America?). We forgot to ask if the hotel uses earth friendly cleaning products. Eating - we asked for a restaurant recommendation (for dinner) from the guy at the front desk. He recommended one restaurant. We tried to squeeze more restaurants out of him (him being a local and this being Paris and all) but we were unsuccessful. We checked out his recommendation, however, nothing on the menu caught our eye. We ended up at La Casita across the Champs-Elysees and had a delicious meal. Location - this hotel is approximately 4 or 5 blocks from the George V metro stop which is on the Champs-Elysees (not far from the Arc de Triomphe). We walked from the metro stop to the hotel (with baggage).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ammalgam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 days. I can't say enough about this hotel. The room was a little small (by American standards) and the TV in the room was small but for the price, you cannot beat the location and the service and friendliness. Its located a few blocks from the Champs Elysee and is close to the Metro if you want to get around Paris. I thought it had its own particular charm and would DEFINITELY both recommend it and stay there again next time we go to Paris. Maybe me and the wife would splurge for a more expensive room this time. To sum up, staff friendly, room nice and clean, proximity to Paris Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, criminally expensive - like the rest of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mingoose
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very much of the boutique style. We stayed in a deluxe room which was tastefully furnished, very clean and with a huge, comfortable double bed. However, even for a boutique hotel, the room was small and the bathroom tiny. For £250/Euro 250 per night I expect someting bigger, especially when not even breakfast is included in the tariff. However, Paris is extraordinarily expensive at the moment (not helped by the weak pound) and I guess we wouldn't have fared better anywhere else. And don't get me wrong, what was provided was faultless, the location excellent and the staff unfailingly polite and helpful. Our stay in Paris was wonderful - it remains a great (if expensive) city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: michel666
Reviews.Content: I treated myself to three nights in Paris for my birthday. I had never been and a friend helped me choose the hotel by location. What a wonderful choice that turned out to be. The staff is extremely helpful, rooms comfortable and clean, bathrooms large and lovely. The Location of the hotel was perfect, peaceful area just steps away from the Champs- Lysees and metro. Couldn't possibly put in words what a wonderful hotel experience this was! Thank you TripAdvisor and Hotel Elysses Regencia!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this one.”
Reviews.Author: sgodyn
Reviews.Content: We were a group of six, this being the second time we have stayed at the Hotel. Only one criticism that is a lack of drawer space in the bedroom. Would stay again great location, friendly staff and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: co-houston
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a last minute decision and it was great. I went to Paris with my dad for a weekend and he is used to 5 star hotels, he thought this place was great. The rooms are small, but well decorated. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. The hotel staff was very friendly. The location was close to the George V. We had breakfast, which was a buffet. There were a lot of options to choose from; however it is expensive. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: addicted2tvl
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris last December as a family (2 adult and 2 kids). We were very happy with this hotel. Even the kids like this hotel so much and didn't want to leave! Friendly staff (they speaks english very well), pretty and charming and big room for Paris standard (we stayed at suite room). Nice toileteries (not generic brand). We will stay in this hotel again for sure for our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, just like the picture”
Reviews.Author: NvRinOnEpLaCe
Reviews.Content: I choose it for a Valentines Day get away and my first time in Paris. The hotel was a wonderful 4 star. The staff was helpful and showed us where there hotel parking was. When we got to the room there were rose petals in the shape of a heart...very romantic. The bathroom was very nice it came with bathrobes and slippers for the both of us. It was close to the Eifle Tower and The Arc de Trimph. It was also a quite hotel I was able to sleep well. We had the American Breakfast and it was delived to us in bed. We only stayed for one night and the day we checked out we where able to keep our car in the parking garage and walk around Paris for the day. I would love to stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: Andy7
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a surprise trip to Paris for my 40th and picked this hotel. Like the other reviewers say, it was a great location, close enough to the attractions but nice and quiet at night time. Having never been to Paris before it was important to us to be able to walk around and soak up the atmosphere. Unfortunately, I did not get the name of the gentleman on reception but he was very helpful with resrvations for a show and a Seine cruise. We were in a superior room which I thought was a great size and the bed was very comfy. Lots of lovely L'occitane products in the bathroom which were replenished every day. I would definitely recommend this hotel again and will be going back to Paris. We found everyone very friendly and willing to speak English.

Reviews.Title: “40th birthday getaway”
Reviews.Author: fussy_40yrold
Reviews.Content: Wy wife uses trip advisor religiously to get a good feel for best hotels in any city. After deciding to go to Paris for her 40th birthday, she used trip advisor and narrowed the search down to Hotel Elysees Regencia. We arrived in Paris, caught the train/metro into George V station, and entered out of subway to a 5 minute walk to the hotel - very easy to find for someone on first trip to Paris. Hotel staff were great with special mention for Pascal who was extremely helpful with recommendations and directions to where we needed to go. Hotel was great, we got upgraded to superior room which was nice (albeit a little small but not unexpected for European city breaks). We have been vacating in USA for last lot of years and rooms are much bigger there so please don't take this as a negative merely a point of note. Hotel location was superb which is so important, with Arc de Triomphe at top of the street, merely a 5 minute walk maximum and Eiffel tower 15 minutes away. If you like Thai - try Asian - it was excellent, and we also did the Viator boat trip down the Seines which was first class. Another bar that was great on the Saturday night was BOUND (a sushi bar / wine bar) - would again recommend. I would have no reservations on recommending the hotel and if we go back to Paris (which we would in a summer month) we will definitely be looking at this hotel as the first port of call.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Hotel Elysees Regencia”
Reviews.Author: TAHES
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for the long weekend and stayed at the Hotel Elysees Regencia for two nights. Even before we arrived, the hotel booked dinner reservations for us for the two nights and helped us get information on the Picasso exhibition tickets that we had ordered over the Internet but that we had not received. When we arrived at 7:30 AM after our overnight flight from Boston, the hotel was able to check us into our room within the hour. The room was very spacious and clean with free wifi. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. We did not have the buffet breakfast because of the price of 19 euros per person. We will definitely stay at this hotel again when we return to Paris. The location is perfect as it is only a few blocks from the Georges V metro stop on the Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, trendy and perfectly located for the Champs Elysee”
Reviews.Author: loveluxurioushotels
Reviews.Content: Athough not imposing from the outside, this boutique hotel is very accommodating on the inside. The hotel has an uber-trendy reception area and equally comfortable rooms. We were greeted by friendly (non-patronising!) Parisian staff at reception and made to feel welcome. Our holiday was booked for us as a surprise as it was our 1st wedding anniversary, and the hotel had obviously been made aware of this as when we walked into our room there was soft music playing on an ipod, rose petals on the bed and champagne on ice - very romantic. Our room was very comfortable, and felt clean and new. We didn't make it to breakfast at all as there were so many places to grab a croissant on the champs elysee we wanted to make the most of our time. We booked an excursion through the hotel costing 69 Euros each (I think), and we were picked up by minibus from the hotel and taken to the notre dame, sacre coeur, arts quarter, a boat trip along the seine and the eiffel towel. Perfect for a whistle stop tour of the famous Parisian sights. It was seamless and well worth the money. If and when we return to Paris we would definitely stay here again as we know the standard was high.

Reviews.Title: “High level boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ckart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and we are highly satisfied. It is whatever asking from a cute, peaceful and clean boutique hotel! We proceed with booking, following the comments from other Trip Advisor reviews and I can admit that almost all the suggestions were absolutely useful. The staff was very friendly, polite and helpful. Without even asking, they upgraded our standard room to a higher class since there was availability and didn't charge us. The room was large, the bed extra big (width), the bathroom good enough, and cleaning was professional. Every night we had our beds turned down and a chocolate candy. The location is great. The street is quite and very cute only 5-7 minutes from metro stations and the Champs Elysees and the are several restaurants and cafe. If you know exactly what a boutique Hotel offers you will be satisfied with this choise

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: AKBOO
Reviews.Content: A delightful hotel, staff excellent - very friendly and helpful. My partner and I booked this quaint hotel for a combined trip of New Year celebration as well as visiting my newly born nephew. We have reasonably expensive taste and this hotel hit the mark in terms of accessibility and requirements. We stayed in a standard room because that's all that was left available - it was adequate but tiny. The only other thing I would say is request not to stay in room 21. It is ridiculously noisy, mainly due to the utility cupboard being right outside the door to the room and the cleaning staff clearly believe that do not disturb simply means don't enter but make as much noise as you like.... never mind. Luckily we had ear plugs with us!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: km52170
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us. We had stayed at the Four Seasons George V for a few days on business. We were staying on for a long weekend as a personal vacation. We were cringing at the $800 price tag for a standard room at the Four Seasons so I found this hotel on trip advisor. I have never booked a hotel solely based on trip advisor, but I thought I would give it a shot. The fact that they allowed you to cancel 24 hours in advance gave us the ability to keep the reservation at the Four Seasons and then check out the E. Regencia in person first. We took a look and then went back and checked out of the Four Seasons and headed over 1 block to the Elysees Regencia. We were warmly welcomed with great service and hospitality. It was impeccably clean and comfortable. The rooms were small, but wonderfully appointed and had windows that opened up to a quaint cobblestone street. We received turndown and premier room amenities. I will definitely stay there my next time in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have made a better choice...”
Reviews.Author: Joshandtia
Reviews.Content: If you go to Paris and don't stay at the Hotel Elysees Regencia you are making a mistake. Pascal and his staff were absolutely fantastic. We had heard that Parisians are not polite and don't speak English. This could not be further from the truth when it comes to this amazing hotel. It was the perfect quiet location a very short walk from everything you could possibly want to do or see. Without even asking, Pascal upgraded our room since there was availability and didn't charge us a penny more than our original room. Thank you so much Pascal. If we come back to Paris in the future we wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel. Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lalger
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 2 nights at the end of October based on tripadvisor.com reviews and I was not disappointed! A 3 minute walk to Arc de Triomphe, a few different metro stations and Champs Elyesse, the location was fantastic. I booked the hotel via the hotels website and the booking went very smoothly. Reception and cleaning staff were attentive and very helpful. The newly refurbished room was a lovely size for a short break with a very nice bathroom. Breakfast was what we have come to expect from a city break hotel so on the second day we decided not to go for breakfast and save the €19. We had an early lunch in a small café called Comptoir de l'Arc‎, a minutes walk down Avenue Marceau towards the Arc de Triomphe, and had a huge delicious salad for €10 each. I think the hotel was worth every penny! Would also like to recommend Ô Chateau Cheese & Wine tasting lunch. We had a brilliant time and can’t praise highly enough! Definitely check out if you are partial to some cheese and wine! My second recommendation is for a restaurant near Eiffel Tower called Au Bon Acceil. We eat at some very nice places and this was one of the best meals my husband and I have ever had. The only bad thing about our Paris weekend was dinner at Chez Andre on Rue Marbeuf…bad food, service and more expensive than Au Bon Acceil. Waste of time and money. Lastly…Crazy Horse is also worth seeing!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fosters14
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, excellent staff, rooms very clean. We will definitely come back again.They do everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “You wont be dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: fussytravelerSydney
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of all the great reviews and I have to say that it met my expectations! The hotel is in a great location - 5 minute walk to champs elysee and not far from a beautiful view of the eiffel tower. There are plenty of great cafes and restuarants around and the George V metro is only a 2 minue walk. The staff are extremely helpful giving great restuarant recommendations (go to Chez Andre) and helped give directions of how to get around with maps of paris & metro information. They were amazing and always happy to help. The rooms are very modern & a decent size for europe standards. They have a french feel with stripped wallpaper and wooden floors. We just booked a standard doule room and were not dissapointed. There is internet access at reception as well as a small bar and sitting area. The photos on the website don't lie. We found the best rate on the hotel website and also organised airport transfers with them. Overall it had everything you need to enjoy Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay at the Hotel Elysees”
Reviews.Author: oxman78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elysees Regencia August 31-September 4. This was our first stop on a wonderful whirlwind tour of France, Italy, and Switzerland. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel immensely. We stayed at nice hotels in all of our cities, but this was one of my favorites. What I LIKED: SERVICE: Overall the service at the hotel was very good. The front desk staff (which is also concierge...as was typical in our hotels) were all very good. I also liked that there was turndown service. BREAKFAST: This was the best breakfast we had in any of our hotels. The staff was very attentive and on top of getting us our coffee. It helped that it wasn't very crowded when we were in the breakfast room. The selection of breakfast items was also very nice. Eggs, of course, and a very nice selection of yogurts, pastries (including little crepes), etc. The room was nice, but it was in the underground, so there wasn't any natural light. ROOM DECOR: Very nicely finished room, though smallish (though that's typical for many European hotels). I thought our room was actually nicer than the pictures of their rooms on the website. QUIET: Our room was quiet. It helped that we faced a small street behind the hotel and that we did not have a room facing Avenue Marceau. If quiet is important to you, then make sure you request a room facing the smaller street (the name of which I can't remember). The side facing Avenue Marceau (which is where the main entrance is) would probably be loud as that is a major street. Additionally, from our window we could see the top of the Eiffel Tower (we were on the 5th floor), that's a view you wouldn't get on the other side of the building. Note, however, that there is another hotel/residential building across the smaller street, so with your window open someone across the way might be able to see into your room. We never saw any peeping toms, but just an FYI for you. What could have been better: SHOWER: This is a ticky-tacky complaint, but the shower door was completely ineffective. We had a shower/tub and there was a little half door that was supposed to keep the water in the shower. It didn't really work out that way and we had a floor that was sopping wet every morning. It wasn't a very big deal, just a small thing that we contended with. ROOM SIZE: While I didn't expect the room to be any larger than it was, this room is fairly small as compared to most American hotels. This was also our smallest room through the entire trip. Again, this is a small thing (we managed just fine). LOCATION: Again, somewhat of a small thing. The good thing is that you're really close to the Arc de Triomphe, the Champs Elysees, and the George V metro. However, it's a bit of a long way to some of the major sites (e.g. Louvre, D'Orsay, Latin Quarter). However, if you eat as much as we did, you can definitely use the walking! OVERALL... We both really liked this hotel and we would highly recommend it. The fifth floor was also great because we had a small step out area off the window which we didn't see on the other floors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, lovely room, breakfast mouthwatering and great location”
Reviews.Author: Bill_McN
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in Paris. The hotel is about 8 minutes walk from the arc de triumph and 5 mins from the Effel tower. It's a typical french hotel, with small bar, excellent service, lovely breakfast. I arranged champagne / rose for my wife and the display was excellent, just what I imagined. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff, too!”
Reviews.Author: MaryLH
Reviews.Content: Like the previous review, we were a family of four who stayed at the hotel in August. We were there for a week and also enjoyed the two family rooms at the end of a hall which we could close off from the rest of the floor. We echo all the great reviews which preceded ours, but would especially like to commend the concierge desk. Since we used them every day for everything from double checking our Metro routes to making restaurant reservations, we must thank them one and all. On our final day, they even printed out directions and maps to help us with a multi-stop trip down to the Loire Valley. When our college French hardly made the grade on the more complicated questions, we were incredibly relieved that the staff spoke such good English. We hope that the hotel management realizes what a competitive advantage it has in its concierge staff, breakfast wait staff, housekeepers and bellmen. Their many kindnesses and assistance greatly enhanced the pleasure of our stay in Paris. We look forward to seeing all of them again in the not-too-distant future. Merci beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “Elysees Regencia was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TLWhite
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 4 year old daughter had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Elysees Regencia for 4 nights this week. The service was amazing, the hotel is clean and beautiful and the location was perfect for us! The hotel is situated a few blocks off the Champs Elysees on a relatively quiet street with wonderful restaurants very nearby. We enjoyed staying in a not so touristy area, but appreciated the proximity to the Eiffel Tower and the metro station. The room size was not a problem for the three of us at all (deluxe triple with king size bed and roll away) and the bathroom size was fine as well. We recommend this hotel highly to anyone traveling to Paris and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TheRfamily
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all the staff at Hotel Elysees Regencia Paris, namely Kathrin for her special attention and care to details is helping our family plan our days in Paris. This hotel is in a perfect location. Spotlessly clean, excellent bedding, toiletries, and spacious. My husband and our two teenage daughters spent three wonderful, safe and quiet nights in this tucked away hotel. We were close by to great shopping, tourist attractions and fantastic Bakeries and Restaurants. We will be recommending Hotel Elysees Regencia Paris to our family and friends and hope to return ourselves soon! Many Thanks The R Family

Reviews.Title: “quality, quality, quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: linfield2004
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique style hotel, perfectly situated between the arch de triomphe & the eiffel tower, the reviews on trip advisor are well justified, the reception staff are superb, & literally cannot do enough for the client, the rooms are individually unique and furnished to the highest standards. Paris is not a cheap destination, but the facilities on offer here combined with the genuine hospitality afforded to guests make this hotel a force to be reckoned with compared to the big name competitors not far away, and at reasonable prices. A big thank you to the the staff at the elysees regencia for a truly special weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: snips1982
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in the Elysees Regencia to surprise my girlfriend for her birthday. The reason I booked here was down to the recommendations through tripadvisor. I have to say we were not disappointed. The Hotel staff were extreamly helpful and spoke perfect English. We even got a room upgrade which was much appreciated. The hotel was clean and good standard. The bedroom (superior double thanks to the upgrade) was perfect and a good size for the center of Paris. The bathroom had a nice touch of petals left over the towels and the beds were turned down in the evening. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Paris, don't look any further.”
Reviews.Author: DROntario
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days with my three kids (age 11 to 16) in August, 2008. Had two adjoining rooms which their website calls the "Family Room". I was booking late and found that nearly all Parisian hotels use a service that does not not confirm an on-line booking but sends you an acknowledgment which is then confirmed or denied 24-48 hours later. Kind of frustrating so I just called the hotel directly and everything was completed within minutes. A tentative, "Parlez-vous anglais?" will result in a quick change to the English language so don't be intimidated! The location is excellent with easy walking distance to Champs Elysee and Eiffel Tower. George V Metro stop a 3-5 minute walk and this is on the line which runs to Louvre, Notre Dame, Le Marais and a stop across bridge from Musee D'Orsay (Paris Visite Metro passes best bargain in the city). Single subway change to get to Montmartre. The staff are very helpful, friendly, fluently bilingual. The property itself on beautiful, treed, quiet street. Rooms very nicely decorated and spacious. Two large (essentially floor to ceiling with "mini-balcony") windows in each room open onto the leafy street. Very comfortable beds. Bathrooms very nicely appointed with L'Occitaine toiletries. Easily set up in-room safe for passports, laptop etc if you wish to use. Free, easily set up, high speed, WiFi in rooms. The buffet breakfast is somewhat expensive by North American standards (19 Euros for adults) but very standard for Europe and was great with excellent scrambled eggs, sausages and bacon, french toast and crepes, cereal, croissants, addictive pain au chocolat, fruit etc etc. Also great bottomless coffee, cappuccino, hot chocolate for kids etc. We essentially used it as a main meal to start the day, then small "snack" in mid-afternoon and then out for a late supper. My kids already missing it after returning home. Did not use the service but they will do same day laundry too. Staff arranged a car (VW minibus) for transport to DeGaulle airport for the four of us with bags for 75 Euros which was very convenient and cheap relative to other choices (for 4 people). Not sure if hotel would arrange pickup using same company but suspect yes. I would recommend this hotel without reservation and would plan on staying again whenever in Paris the next time. It felt like a "home away from home". Think it is great value relative to many other hotels. Would recommend for families with teenagers, couples looking for romantic location/experience. Also families with small children although I found all of Paris very tolerant and welcoming of kids in strollers. Just might have to be careful to keep those windows locked (they are very secure actually) but think this would be true of nearly all hotels anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MikeWebb
Reviews.Content: I would just like comment on how impressed we were with this hotel. All of the staff were extremely helpful and professional, the decor in every part of the hotel was very tasteful. Rooms always kept tidy, sound proofed from the road outside and air conditioned. We stayed for our honeymoon and found that the location was great and atmosphere relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Paris Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: DanDSacramento
Reviews.Content: We just completed a five night stay in Paris and found this hotel to be nothing short of fantastic! It is located just a short ten minute walk from both the Eifell Tower and Arch De Triumph. My wife and I stayed with our two teenage granddaughters and the room we were provided had ample space. We picked this hotel because of the positive reviews on Trip Advisor and would echo the comments made by other travelers. The staff at the hotel and Katherin in particular really go out of thier way to make your stay enjoyable. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel for a Hen Weekend! Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: KAREN084
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Regenica for my friends Hen weekend. The hotel was just as the pictures on the hotels website. If you go out the hotel & walk 5 mins down the paris streets you are hit with the wonderful view of the Eiffel we went to a little Parisian Cafe called Chez Francis recommended by the hotel which was lovely for a bite to eat & wine while enjoying the view of the Eiffel. The Arc de Triumphe 10mins walk & only one street away from the Champs Elysee so the location is just PERFECT!!! The rooms were lovely clean modern style rooms although small but this is expected in any large city!!!! Hotel staff were extremely helpful & friendly & dealt with any of our requests from the party of 12 girls. The breakfast room is down in the basement & there is a full array of breakfast options to choose from, loved the pancakes & maple!!! I will definetely be coming back to Paris & would not think of staying in any other hotel as the friendly staff, location are just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms great location”
Reviews.Author: luray
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for our 10th wedding anniversary. we were not disappointed - it's a gorgeous quiet hotel just 5 minutes walk from Tour Eiffel and Arc De Triomphe. our room was the same as the one they show on their website. We arrived to rose petals, tea and coffee making facilities, and macarrons. The bed was turned down every night and chocolates left on it. the room had lovely big windows, nice timber flooring and a nice crisp feel to it. We didn't have breakfast prefering to eat al fresco in one of paris' many boulangeries. Definitely would recommend this hotel - relaxed and perfect location - ideal for second honeymoon!!

Reviews.Title: “Blissfully Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kales631
Reviews.Content: There really isn't enough I could say about this hotel. We booked through the hotel website (after reading the reviews on trip advisor) and my husband advised the hotel that we would be celerating our wedding anniversary and my 30th b-day while in Paris and requested a balcony if possible. When we arrived in Paris we were blown away by our service at the hotel. We arrived much earlier than check in time but they took our luggage and asked us to have a seat in the lounge, offered us delicious coffee and our room was quickly prepared while we waited. When we walked into our room I was overwhelmed by how perfect it was--gorgeously decorated, rose petals strewn everywhere, yummy petit fours to welcome us, L'Occitane toiletries and best of all--they upgraded our room to one of the top rooms, with a balcony and a VIEW of the Effel tower. Over the course of our stay, are beds were turned down evey night with chocolates and a different L'Occitane product every night, we were recommended to a wonderful restaurant on my birthday and they made the reservations for us and everything. The place was spotless, the staff was fantastic and our stay was blissfully perfect! I cannot recommend this place enough. My husband and I will most certainly return here when we visit Paris again!!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem of a hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: dunnEngland
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris to celebrate our daughters 18th birthday and we couldn't have choosen a better hotel for this occasion. The rooms are small, but you expect that in a city hotel, and are decorated to a high standard with colourful and 'funky' interiors. The rooms are well equipted with all the facilities that you would expect from a four star hotel and the pictures on the hotel website are very accuarte and give a really good idea of what to expect. The location of this hotel is brilliant being close to all of the major tourist attractions and there are plenty of restaurants/bars near to the hotel. But what sets this hotel apart from the others is the helpfulness of the staff...nothing was too much trouble and they went out of their way to make our stay special. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value, Great Location; Even Better service”
Reviews.Author: JB777NYC
Reviews.Content: While it probably does not get 5 stars in some travel guides, the Elysees Regencia is a great hotel in the perfect location and a 5 star hotel in my book. You wont find any hotel snobs staying there; only savvy travelers who appreciate value and refuse to pay for stars alone. Central and within walking distance to the major Parisian sites. The rooms are a real good value considering that hotels 1 block away charge almost 3x as much; I have stayed in the others. Dont be fooled by the unassuming front space. The rooms are spacious and stylish. The staff is young and enthusiastic AND very professional. I had a personal situation and they were understanding and very helpful. Katherin and her colleagues are the BEST. They do their part to help the French reputation for service. I travel alot in western Europe, so when in Paris, I will be there for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HKBride06
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room which is larger than the size of a standard room from 30th Jun for 6 nights. Its our first trip in Paris. The size of rooms in Paris hotels are relatively small. I am glad we paid extra to stay in a larger room. Everything they provided meet our expectations - cleanliness, services, location, room size..etc. The neighbourhood is nice and quiet and we felt very safe to walk around even at nights. We had three large and heavy suitcases as we've been travelling round the world for weeks. Paris is our last destination. We requested a late checkout and the hotel was nice enough to arrange for 4pm. Our flight didn't leave Paris till 7pm. We therefore able to make the most of our trip by taking a nice walk around after lunch. I would say this hotel offered good value for money and will recommend to friends in future.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and well situated”
Reviews.Author: PlantHead
Reviews.Content: An old Parisian town house which has been given the modern touch. The room was lovely and much bigger than I expected, the bathroom was brilliant with lots of extra bits and bobs (freebies)The bed was huge, the misses says a little hard (cough) but a small complaint. Breakfast was an extra cost and a little expensive (you can find a good breakfast just along the street in one of the many brasseries) but the scrambled egg was excellent, worth the money if you are hungry. The staff were friendly and I have no complaints about any of the service, the room was serviced perfectly everytime we went out, not just in the morning. An expensive hotel but we got what we paid for, and the location was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a first visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: GS123
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for our first visit to Paris. Good location - just a short walk from the Champes Elysees - within easy reach of all the sights. Very friendly and helpful and knowledgeable staff who made excellent dinner recommendations. Our room was upgraded from a standard room to a junior suite on arrival - very nice! Easy to see why it's so highly rated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Louvre0208
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel! We have just returned from a weekend at this hotel and it was great! Ideally placed for everything. We found the closest metro to be Alma Marceau. Having stayed at the George V and Crillon previously this hotel was up there with the best of them - and we will definitely be staying here next time we go to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ccosculluela
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location. The staff is extremely "user friendly". They go out of their way to assist you in any way. We stayed in a deluxe room which is larger than the standard rooms. Hotels in Paris are generally small but we found the Deluxe room to be fine. It is in a very safe area, within walking distance of most major attractions, George V (designer shopping) ET, CE etc. It is even within walking distance to the metro that takes you to Versailles. We found this better than going there on a "tour" as you can stroll the wonderful gardens at your leisure and see the petite trianon. The tours generally don't allow for that much wandering on your own. I highly recommend that you check out the bicycles that are right outside the hotel steps about 30 feet to the left. Paris has this great bike rental system. You pick up a bike at one of the many bike stands and return it at ANY bike stand around the city. Be aware that you should return a bike to a stand if you plan to stop off at a place instead of locking it to a post. That way you won't incur usage fees. Simply return the bike, do your thing and return to the bike stand to rent another one. It was a great way to see Paris as a local as we went into neighborhoods that we would otherwise not have seen. Oh by the way, a French lady advised us that bikes are allowed to use the bus lane on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Leo2002
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and had a wonderful stay. The staff was very friendly and always so helpful with questions, dinner reservations, ideas for things to do, etc. The hotel itself is not very large, as in the lobby, etc, but it's part of its charm unless you like a huge lobby with lots of hustle and bustle. In fact, the lobby was usually quiet. Our room, I believe we had a deluxe, was a good size- as well as the bathroom. Everything was modern and sleek, and very clean. We only had breakfast one morning in the hotel. It was pricey, as is Paris in general, and it was generally good. The selection was somewhat basic compared to larger hotels we've stayed in but it was still good- the quality of the food was great. There are cafe's nearby- one next door- but they didn't seem to have a full breakfast menu so we walked down to Place Alma and ate at Cafe Corona a few times where we had omelettes, etc. The location is very convenient to the metro and to the Champs Elysees. It is on a large avenue- Marceau- but it's quiet in and of itself without many businesses. You only need to walk a few min. in either direction to find the action, though. It's probably a plus to not be in the middle of the action as far as the noise level too. All in all we had an excellent stay and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Viking
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in June 2008. In short this is a great little hotel. The staff is very friendly, polite and helpful, and did everything they could to make our stay a nice experience. The room was great and very nicely decorated. The small touches, such as the rose pedals on the towel and the cuddly pink pillows on the bed, did a lot for us. The breakfast buffet was great with all kinds of pastry, fresh fruits, cereals, youghurts, eggs, bacon and sausages. The breakfast locale, in the old cellar, is also very nice. The location is great: 5 min. walk from the Arc de Triumph, 5 minutes walk from the Seine and 5 minutes from Champ Elysees. Staying at this hotel made our stay in Paris a very enjoyable experience and I recommend it to everyone looking for a nice little cosy hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “2 Day Paris Break”
Reviews.Author: Jane131262
Reviews.Content: I chose the Elysee primarily from the reviews from this website, which had been fantastic and to the most part they are completely true. The hotel has an excellent location on the Ave Marceau. We took the Air France bus from the airport which dropped us off at the Arc de Triomphe, it was then a short 10 minute walk over to the hotel. The bus was great, clean, prompt and only cost 22 euros for the return ticket. The staff at the hotel were very attentive, we arrived around 2pm, our room wasnt ready but within 5 minutes they had got it all ready for us. I travelled to Paris with my 13 year old son, the room we were allocated was a twin room on the top floor over looking the front of the hotel, spacious, clean and modern. My only complaint came at night time, once you turned off the TV etc... all you could hear was the chugging of a generator of some sort coming from the non-guest room next door, it took quite some time to get to sleep the first night as it went on all through the night, had we been staying for more than 2 nights I would have requested a room move. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as it was over priced and you could get breakfast easily and at a cheaper price in any of the local cafes in the area. The hotel is ideally placed for the Metro, which was quick and easy to use, very close to the Eiffel Tower, took us about 15 minutes to walk over, and only a 5 minute walk to the Champs Elysee. I would definitely return to the hotel as it was small and personal and a fab location.

Reviews.Title: “Personal service, excellent location, difficult to fault”
Reviews.Author: BotanyBay
Reviews.Content: Spent six nights during May 2008. Location as noted by others is excellent. Stroll to The Trocadero to view the ET or mooch in a cafe, only a few hundred meters from Arc De Triomph and Champs Elysees, many great restaurants around George V are only minutes away and if you feel energetic (we did!), stride down Avenue Foch and soon you are in the giant expanses of the Bois de Bouloigne where rabbits hop freely. Room was cosy, well decorated and clean. Smallish but by Paris standards not bad. Bathroom well equipped with very small separate toilet. Best thing about this hotel is the personal service. Not fussy but knowledgeable and helpful Breakfast can be had in the gorgeous cellar location and its excellent -but quite pricey - so we went 5 meters to the right of the hotel front door to the Cafe Moureax (sp?) where an excellent coffee and croissant can be had for a fraction of the price. Try Bistro Alfred close by (Reception will advise) and also Entrecot, a Parisian institution where there is no menu but the best steaks in town! I visit paris twice a year for work and this will become my home away from home for sure

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Red_LFC
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for three nights in May 08 to celebrate her 30th birthday. On arrival, first impressions were good. Clean modern entrance with friendly staff. Checked in quickly and room was spacious and more than I'd expected. Staff were freidnly & helpful throughout the visit and we had no issues. Hotel is in an excellent location, 5 mins walk to metro, Champs Elysees, 15 mins to Eiffel Tower. I booked this hotel having read many good reviews on this site and they are all deserved. We had a wonderful stay and look forward to returning again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Elysees vs. American Airlines Service”
Reviews.Author: brooklynjoe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week on late April, 2008. It was wonderful. Here is the difference between American Airlines and this hotel's service. On the last day, our flight from Paris to JFK was cancelled by American Airlines. We had already checked out of the hotel. We called American Airlines, waded through their voicemail options, and then were put on hold for 45 minutes. Finally, we were told that American Airlines could instead put us on a connecting flight but it wouldn't leave for another day. This flight would connect THROUGH DALLAS that would turn our 7 hour direct flight into 16 hours of connecting flights. I asked AA if they could put us on their direct flight the next day and they told us that there were no more economy seats left; there were Business Class seats but they were holding those for "paying customers." Since we paid almost $800 each for our coach seats, I asked what is the definition of a "paying customer." No real response. So we turned around and asked Hotel Elysees if we could book another night in the hotel. Unfortunately they were already booked solid and had no rooms available. But instead of just turning us away, they called another hotel down the street and then told us that this hotel would give us a room for the same rate we paid Hotel Elysees. We walked down the block and were put in one of Paris' nicest hotels and they gave us a $2000 per night suite for much much less. There was an outside balcony that overlooked the Eiffel Tower. It was amazing. And we've still never heard why AA cancelled our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gianmaria
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed there for some days. The room was beautiful and spacious and our was overlooking the Eiffel Tour, also the bathroom was large and confortable, at least in comparison with the standard in Paris. The ambient is very stilish and all the common spaces are well decorated, this hotel is really a boutique hotel with contemporary decorations. The locations is even better than you expected, a step away from the Champs Elysee, the boutique and the Paris' most chic restaurants and, as it's not far from the hotel, don't forget the Happy Hour Champagne at the Seers! Finally, we enjoyed the Elysees in any aspect!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service & location!”
Reviews.Author: rosebud4
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a fantastic front desk staff. They made reservations for our dinners and made great suggestions for other options when one of our choices was closed. The rooms and bathrooms are small, but it is Paris. The location was perfect. Walking distance to the metro and several local sites. Great little cafes' just down the street with a great nightime view of the Effel Tower. If you are taking a cab to the hotel from the airport or train have the name of the hotel written on a piece of paper otherwise it may not translate. Once we got to the hotel we picked up a pack of matches to use as our cab driver directions.

Reviews.Title: “C'est magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: DJ139
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a wonderful week in Paris at the Elysees Regencia. We picked the hotel based upon the glowing TripAdvisor reviews, and we were not disappointed. The hotel is located in a rather staid part of Paris, without the vibrant street life of St. Germain or the Marais. This means a good walk or a metro ride to get to popular sites, restaurants and shopping. Fortunately the Elysees Regencia is located a short walk from at least five metro stops; the closest, and the one we used regularly, is the George V on the Champs Elysees. It is also an easy walk to the Arc de Triomphe at the top of Avenue Marceau, as well as to the Eiffel Tower in the other direction. We booked a deluxe double on the fourth floor, with two large windows overlooking Avenue Marceau (a note: Avenue Marceau is a busy street and, while the dual-glazed windows keep out the worst of the noise, lite sleepers should request a room at the back of the hotel). The room was quite large by European standards, with a comfortable king bed, a desk, an armoire/entertainment center and two club chairs. The rooms are very nicely furnished in a clean, contemporary style with dark woods and bright accent colors (our room was aniseed). The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean, and the bath was well-stocked with soft towels, shampoo, soaps and even shaving and nail care kits. Breakfast, served under the stone vaults of the basement, featured a good selection of pain au chocolat, croissants, breads, crepes, cereals, fresh fruit, eggs, sausage, juices and coffee. The price is a bit steep at 19 euro, but is well worth it for the excellent quality and convenience. But the best feature of the Elysees Regencia is its superb young staff. From the front desk (especially Kathrin, who made all our dinner reservations, and Pascal-Arthur, who arranged for a car to take us to the airport) to the breakfast room to the doorman, the hotel staff are wonderfully friendly, polite and professional (not to mention fluent in English). From the moment we walked in we were made to feel welcome, and every request or question was met with a smile and a prompt and efficient response. It is the staff that makes the Elysees Regencia so special. We will definitely stay here again when (not if!) we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The Best little 4 star in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bellefast
Reviews.Content: Returning to Paris for the 5Th time I wanted a small boutique type hotel rather than the large 5 stars I had used before. The staff alone make this hotel worth staying at. I was badly let down by a local restaurant ( The Cafe L'Homme ! ) & the day before my trip emailed the hotel who gave me many wonderful suggestions for special occasion dining at every price level. Pascal & Karin were the perfect hosts. They assisted us with referrals, reservations and transfers. We arrived a lot earlier than planned & dallied around the Champs Elysees for longer than was required for our suite to be ready. When we returned Pascal stalled us for a few minutes so ice could be renewed for our champagne and candles freshly lit in the room ( more "Four Seasons" than 4 star ) Everything was simply perfect. The address is a great point of origin for all sights and the buffet breakfast was of a very high standard. Whilst we had no need to avail of room service we noted the prices were more than decent. In fact the minibar was such good value for a hotel we availed of it - which is something I usually never do. We had the loft suite, which included a comfortable seating area & a wonderful multi-jet massage shower. A view over the rooftops of Paris & yes it did have an Eiffel Tower view whilst it was just about the top 5Th of it you couldn't complain - you know if the staff would bring it closer they could.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous upgrade”
Reviews.Author: CJ1920
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a one night stay at the Hotel Elysees Regencia Paris and cannot compliment them enough on our visit. We arrived early to check-in (around 11am) and were told we were being upgraded to a suite. It was beautiful with a separate living area and large claw-foot bath. It was a lovely surprise and very much appreciated. It was room 10 and I was worried about noise as it was beside the stairs, but we were not disturbed. The staff were incredibly helpful at all times and recommended an excellent restaurant nearby for dinner. The location is great, ideally situated for seeing the sights in Paris. We had breakfast in the hotel and although quite pricey they did have a good selection of meats, cheeses and fruit. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in the 16e”
Reviews.Author: Feargal_FitzPatrick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last weekend (18/19/20 APR 2008). The quality of the hotel and staff made a positive impact on what was, overall, a wonderful weekend in Paris. Finding the hotel on Avenue Marceau was straightforward. Check-in was trouble-free and the room provided was in line with what was booked. All staff were friendly and happy to help us out with any queries we had, despite the fact we had few words of the French language. The hotel is in easy reach of Etoile and 2 other Metro stations (George V & Kleber). We only ate breakfast in the hotel and, both times, the food on offer at the buffet could not be faulted in terms of quality and variety. If we return to Paris, we would be happy to book a room here once again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Cosy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Harps
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. It didn't disappoint. I chose it because my wife was running in the Paris Marathon and the Hotel's location was very close to the start and finish. It was ideally located for the metro which in turn was excellent to get around to see all the sights. The current Euro/Pound fluctuations made Paris quite expensive, but for a Hotel all it's food and drink prices were comparable. The breakfast was brilliant and good value as it is buffet style so you can go and help yourself (many times!!). I would definitely stay there again. The only very slight moan was that the loo was seperate from the bathroom, it was a very small space and with the door closed I easily banged by elbows on the side and my feet touched the facing wall when sat!! Also the loo was facing you as you opened the room door.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thoseinfavour
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two girls (15 & 11) stayed here for three nights in ground floor suite. Price-wise, broadly comparable to central London as it's in a fantastic location within walking distance of the Champs Elysees. The room was lovely, rather like a bathroom surrounded by sleeping/living space. A great shower and fabulous freestanding clawfoot bath plus two sinks. Forgot about the 1 hour time difference with UK so we all slept in on the first morning. Someone obviously realised we weren't going to arrive in the breakfast room as booked so brought everything to the room. I believe we weren't charged any extra which was very gracious. The room was beautifully clean and tidy every time we came back from sightseeing and the staff were immensely helpful and charming throughout. Very nice indeed, would definitely return. Kevin, West London

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMaxwell
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at this hotel at the beginning of April. We booked a deluxe room and had a fuschia room on the 5th floor. It was quiet and clean. When we arrived we found some sweets and a bottle of water in the room. The beds were turned down nightly and a chocolate left on the duvet. Nice little touches all around. The toiletries were lovely and the shower good. The staff were very friendly and helpful and you get a welcome pack of information. As other travellers have said, this hotel is within walking distance of the Champs Elysees and it is also very easy to catch a bus to various museums such as the Musee d'Orsay. We found a reasonable cafe for breakfast "La Mascotte" at the bottom of the street at Alma Marceau. I would recommend avoiding one of the other restaurants at Alma Marceau, the Corona. The food was awful but the bill was high. A chic area doesn't mean good food unfortunately. The best place we ate at was "Le Pamphlet" at Filles du Calvaire. You can find it with a Google search. The food was really excellent, they do a fixed price menu, and the Patronne, very friendly too. We had a brilliant stay in Paris, the hotel was a big part of that.

Reviews.Title: “Just book, go and enjoy!! Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: super76
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short and sweet. Booked the junior suite in the hotel for the weekend for my girlfriends' birthday, largely based on the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. Everything was simply perfect. Great friendly, helpful, knowledable, pleasant staff who each spoke perfect English. The room cleaners were non intrusive, the American breakfast was superb, the location perfect and the hotel had a genuine ambiance that made you feel at home. The suite was lovely, but I also had a look at other rooms and they were also of a very high standard. Even when it was raining we were offered a complimentary umbrella, a small gesture, but a nice touch. To sum up then, just go ahead and book this hotel with confidence, it won't disappoint. Thanks to all the staff for a really memorable and happy stay. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryNIreland
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to this hotel and my experience was just as good as the last!! The hotel is situated in a quiet street away from all the bustle but a short distance from all the main tourist attractions. The rooms are small , however the standard of cleanliness throughout the hotel is excellent, the breakfast whilst expensive was very good, breakfast staff was friendly and helpful. I sampled the wine from the bar on a couple of occassions as the weather was bad,again it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stanleyCavan
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, the previous two reviews say everything there is to say about this hotel. I can highly recommended this hotel for a wonderful stay in Paris and the staff certainly make this hotel, as already mentioned Katrin and Nicholas were most helpful and informative. Our room was perfect and even though we were on the busy street side there was no noise as the french windows block out any traffic noise. Also each time we went out for the evening the staff came in and turned the bed down and left little chocolates. If you're intending to stay in Paris this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: J1W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as a surprise birthday treat. I lovely hotel in a central but quiet location, we stayed in a deluxe room with balcony over the main street, the room was wonderfully presented. With little extras that had my partner brimming, apparently girls like free l'occatane toiletries & cosmetics!! the staff were very friendly and helpful, they even booked a restaruant outside the hotel on our behalf when we can't book the one we wanted to go too. would definately stay here again if visiting paris...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: birch63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two children (ages 16 and 20) stayed at the Elysees Regencia for 5 nights last week and we can not say enough about it! Although we were originally booked at the sister property, The Hotel Bassano, we received an e-mail in London from our travel agent that the hotel was not ready and we were being transferred to the Elysees Regencia instead. A little hesitant at not knowing what to expect, any concerns we had were quickly put to rest once we checked in. We had two rooms, a standard with two twin beds for the kids and a superior for us, and both were lovely. Freshly renovated, immaculately clean, very spacious by European standards and decorated in a pleasing aniseed colour palette, they exceeded our expectations. The location of the property is superb - a block from the Champs d'Elysees, and walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower, Metro station etc. As well, Rue Marbeuf, a street of amazing cafes and bistros, is only a couple of blocks away. We ate breakfast at the hotel on 3 mornings and found the variety and quality of the food very good. It was also very convenient as they start serving very early and you could just walk in, help yourself and be off to start your day of exploring Paris. The price was very comprable with the neighbourhood bistros where we ate on our other 2 mornings. What really stands out about the Elysees Regencia however is the staff - most particularly for us, Kathrin and Nicholas. They were fantastic!! Kathrin, no matter how busy she was, always had time to offer advice regarding tours ("Don't book a tour of Versailles - just buy train and admission tickets at the Metro and go on your own" - THE BEST ADVICE!!!), restaurants, shopping areas and attractions. She truly made our first trip to Paris easier and more enjoyable - Thank You Kathrin! Overall, I'd very highly recommend the Elysees Regencia. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, modern, welcoming”
Reviews.Author: pickledpepper
Reviews.Content: Guided by TripAdvisor reviews, we chose this hotel because it was very central and had a 'classy' look to it, with prices to match. Using the TripAdvisor 'best offers' system, we got a very good price for a three-night stay. Although it still couldn't be described as cheap, it was a lot cheaper than the highest quoted price, and value for money. The hotel is in one of a number of charming boulevards radiating from the spectacular Place Charles de Gaulle, home to the Arc de Triomphe. It is therefore within easy walking distance of the Seine (Pont d'Alma) and the Arc de Triomphe. Several Metro stops a few minutes walk away, nearest George V on the Champs d'Elysees itself. The hotel is surprisingly intimate, the reception area small, but it has a restrained elegance. A charming spiral stair (and a lift ) leads to the floors above, and each floor has only a few rooms - ours (the 4th) had only three other rooms on it. Our room was not huge, but combined graciousness with tasteful designer features, a very pleasant bathroom and separate loo (with proper doors that locked from the inside). Toiletries were by Occitaine, bath robes and complimentary slippers. Bed with extra cushions was comfortable and warm, the room was quiet with no traffic noise. We had room service (there is no restaurant) and my wife's simple omelette was fresh, nicely presented, and inexpensive. Room service was friendly, courteous and prompt. Every enquiry or request was handled professionally and as if we 'mattered'. Attention to detail is a real feature of the ethos of service at this hotel. On our last evening we had a handwritten note from the manager with a small gift. On arrival the bathroom contained a sprinkling of freshly picked petals, and there was a little tray of confectionery on the dresser (we noticed the same little meringues on sale at MacDonalds in the Champs d'Elysees, but it didn't spoil the effect!). When we left the concierge offered to safe-keep our bags while we strolled around the city before catching our train home, another considerate touch that added to the sense of being cosseted. Altogether a fine hotel with staff who can feel proud of the result of their efforts with guests, and every centime of the price we paid was worth it. Strongly recommended for an unforgettable stop-over in Paris. We shall certainly choose this hotel on further trips to this fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “A nicely-presented, good quality hotel.”
Reviews.Author: k0pacabana
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a fairly ‘well-to-do’ and peaceful neighbourhood. The Arc de Triomphe, at the top of the Champs Elysees, is a 7 or 8 minute walk slightly uphill from the hotel. The nearest Metro station, George V, is a further 2 or 3 minutes down the Champs Elysees. The station is on Line 1 of the Metro system which stops at many of the popular destinations including Louvre, and Concorde, and Chatelet Les Halles where you can switch to most of the other lines. The Trocadero is a 10 to 15 minute walk and offers great views of the Eiffel Tower, as well as a number of interesting places to eat. The Tower itself can be reached in 20 to 25 minutes on foot but be prepared to queue for a long time if you want to ascend the Tower. There are many restaurants and cafes in the vicinity which should cater for most tastes and wallets. A quick note for foodies: The 2 star Michelin restaurant, Alain Senderens, which is located in Place de la Madeleine, is excellent and only a 10-minute taxi ride away. There have been some comments on this site about the roads outside being busy at night. On one side of the hotel there is a main road and, of course, there will be traffic noise - it is a city after all. We were not troubled by traffic noise and the hotel is the quietest in which I have stayed in Paris whilst remaining close to the action. I think it is also important to note that at no time did we feel uncomfortable strolling the surrounding streets, even in the early hours on the way back from restaurants. Now for the hotel. Inside, everything looks very good. The chic décor is nicely done. It certainly has the feel of a quality establishment. We stayed for two nights in a standard double room which was well-presented and very clean. Although the entire hotel has recently been fitted-out, there were signs of early wear-and-tear: a large tile was loose in our bathroom; there was some sort of duct-tape covering damage on one of the edges of the desk; and one of the bedside light fittings was loose and a little battered. On the plus side the shower was excellent (a rare thing in hotels these days), and the Sharp Aquos LCD television was a nice touch. I should also echo other reviewers' comments that wardrobe and storage space is very limited. The main draw of this place is the staff who are all very helpful spoke excellent English. They were happy to assist wherever they could, be it in recommending sites to visit and places to eat, or simply arranging for an ironing board or power adaptor to be sent to the room. Everything we asked for was dealt with immediately and to our satisfaction. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel. The main reason for this was that a) we tend to eat late breakfasts (or none at all) on our travels exploring the city, and b) 19 Euros for a basic continental breakfast seemed expensive. There are countless cafes and bars everywhere, most of which will offer better value for breakfast. Now the minus points…. On arriving at the hotel at 2pm (1 hour after the hotel expected us) we were disappointed to have to wait nearly 30 minutes for our room to be readied. Being a weekend break time is precious. This wait ate into our valuable holiday time and we were a little disappointed. And the 'welcome' drinks we received? I'll come to that later. The prices for room service were extortionate, even for Paris. The cheapest bottle of (mediocre) wine was 23 Euros. You want a quarter bottle of average champagne? 30 Euros. Fortunately there is a small store almost adjacent to the hotel where I bought a couple of nice bottles of Macon Villages for less than 6 Euros each! I might have given this hotel 5 out of 5, but I am not going to do so. Why? Well, on checking out I was presented with the bill which included a charge of 10 Euros for the ‘welcome’ drinks we received on our arrival. Taken aback, I questioned this with the receptionist and the response was a simple shrug of the shoulders – an entirely inappropriate response. (Unfortunately I had a plane to catch and did not have the time to take it up with the management.) This left a bad taste in our mouths – a shame because our stay had been great up to that point.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quiet street!”
Reviews.Author: panixxxx
Reviews.Content: I booked a superior room effortlessly through their website which was cheaper than the online travel agents. The hotel is located ideally between the Champs D'Elysees and The Eiffel Tower. The Metro is a close walk too! It's on a tree lined street but is very.
