I am sensitive to noise, but heard nothing even though we faced the street. I would recommend the more spacious superior room as the standard rooms looked smaller. They provide toileteries and a hairdryer. There is a communal laptop downstairs (free) for surfing. We didn't have breakfast there but chose to walk to the Champ D'Elysees. Cheaper and so close. Reception staff were extremely friendly and were always ready to answer questions and knew Paris very well. I would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JKuo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Elysees Regencia for 4 nights in March 2008. We chose this hotel after extensive research on the internet. Due to the favorable reviews of the hotel on TripAdvisor, we decided to stay here during our first ever trip to Paris. We have absolutely no regrets. Everything was perfect. The location was excellent - on a quiet street near the Champs Elysees, the Arc de Triomphe, the Eiffel Tower, and the George V metro stop on the Line 1 metro. Our hotel room was very modern, trendy, and chic and extremely clean. The size was also "big" for European standards. (We had a Double Deluxe Room). The bathroom and its amenities were a nice touch. The staff were so friendly, spoke English, and helped us with every request including making dinner reservations at multiple restaurants before our arrival to Paris (we emailed them our request). Although the room price was expensive (compared to American hotels), given that we were in Paris, I thought it was worth every penny. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip. The only negatives I can think of are 1) we could hear water running (probably the shower) from other rooms and 2) there is no actual restaurant on the premises. However, this last point didn't matter because there are hundreds of restaurants and places to eat right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time, Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: steveg199
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a 40th Birthday treat after reading all the reviews on this site. So knew what to expect & the hotel did not disappoint, great hotel, great location (you can get better hotels in better locations, but they would cost much more). Booked the romance package. Hotel is a 5 min walk to the Arc de Triomphe in one direction & 10 mins in the other to the Eiffel Tower. We stayed in one of the suites & it was very nice indeed. Breakfast at the hotel was very good. No restaurant in the evening, but they do have a basic room service menu & also a bigger choice room service via menus from a local restaurant or two. We did have one big problem when we stayed, it was mid Dec & the office next door to the hotel had their Christmas Party on the Saturday night - from about 10pm till 3:30am!!! - We could not get that much sleep as it was right next door to our room. We did complain to the hotel reception & they did try & sort it out by calling the police. To be fair to the hotel, they had not been warned by the company next door what was planned so it was as much a surprise to them as it was to me. When we went to check out the following day, as compensation, the hotel offered us that night for free or another night for free on a return visit. Due to having Euro-star booked we had to come home. But the hotel was so wonderful; we will be taking up the free night offer in June when we stay again for a couple of nights, but this time we are taking our daughter as well. This hotel does get alot of reviews, that is partly because they do suggest people rate them on trip advisor: but they only do this as they are confident people will write a good review: as it's a great hotel with great staff that give great service: so what more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: batigan
Reviews.Content: I spent my honymoon last week in paris at this hotel which was perfect for my stay, always clean rooms whenever i go out and come back to my room, outstanding service, romantic rooms, friendly staff and helpful. If you are looking for a good value for money deal, this is the one for sure. Negatives: - Noisy cause it's on a main street and near a hospital. - Free porn channel, did not expect to see this in my honymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Heapey14
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Friendly staff. Good location near the eiffel tower and champs elysees. Just over a 5 walk from George V metro stop. Excellent helpful staff and lovely gift on check out. Rooms are clean and quite roomy for Paris. Lovely fluffy towels and great toiletries. Lovely macaroons in the room on arrival. Would definately stay there again...... Good value for money. Great little street market (food and clothing mainly) 5 min walk away on a saturday morning on Ptd Wilson... great to walk through on the way to the eiffel tower and trocadero. Nearby restaurant and deli 'Nouro' was excellent.. great french/lebonese food.... packed on a friday night. Try "A La Petite Chaise" in St Germain on Rue de Grenelle. Toulouse Lautrec ate there... established in 1680. Wonderful french food and staff great. Do not go to the aquarium ... expensive and not worth it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ghyll
Reviews.Content: My husband, two friends and I were due to stay at Hotel Bassano but, as it was being refurbished, were offered rooms at this hotel. The staff were extremely obliging, the rooms were of a good size, beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. Nothing was too much trouble for the desk staff. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: CCJE
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic 2 night stay. The staff were very friendly and attentive. They went out of their way to assist us with any requirements. Free internet access was available on the ground floor.The rooms were of good size, tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean. The breakfasts were served in the basement of the hotel which had arched stone ceilings. There was good choice and everything was very fresh. Service was excellent and attentive. Coffee cups filled frequently.The location was excellent in an upmarket of Paris, close to the Champs Elysees and the Seine. There were some excellent cafe restaurants down the road near the Alma bridge, but they were expensive. In the evening, we ate in the Latin Quarter which was a short metro ride from the hotel. Here, there are plenty of restaurants to choose from and something to suit all tastes. Also, meals are competitively priced-3 course meal for 10 euros.Would definitely stay at the Elysees Regencia again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Accomodations & Staff !”
Reviews.Author: Redwingman
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this wonderful hotel!While I flew in from the States, my wife flew in from Toullouse for my birthday week-end. The staff there were so considerate from the time I arrived all thru our 3 nite stay. Not only did they prepare the room (flower petals on the luxurious towels and a special cake from a local bakery), but they would always take time out to share with us places to see, (like the wonderful outdoor Market on Sunday's) that you wouldn't know unless you were a Parisian.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LaineyKildare
Reviews.Content: Hotel has excellent location, 5 mins from the Champs Elysees. Front desk staff could not have been more helpful, from giving sightseeing ideas to their knowledge of good restaurants etc. They also went out of their way to help when our laptop crashed! Rooms small but in excellent condition. Top place to stay, would recommend to all my friends and will definitely be going back to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cody0
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently spent a week in Paris at this hotel. The service at the hotel was exceptional from the person on the front desk, to the bar keeper, and restaurant staff. Our room was extremely well kept and maintained. They even have high end soap and shampoo from France that we thoroughly enjoyed. The in house coffe and tea is a blessing at the end of a long day. The buffet breakfast could not have been topped and the people looking after it were courtieous and attentive to our every need. The location was perfect for us to walk to many of the attractions or it we even wanted to go by metro. Taxis were availalbe just steps away. It was a truly an excellent choice for us and we would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: bse5
Reviews.Content: Definitely above average in every way - service & accommodations. Spacious rooms (for Paris...or any big city for that matter), most of the staff is exceptionally pleasant and eager to please. However, some of the front desk staff on the night shift are less than friendly (we couldn't figure this out...it kind of odd actually, considering it was such a stark contrast from the day shift employees.) Very clean, modern design. *Excellent location*. Overall a great place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Great in lovely location”
Reviews.Author: musicman2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in a fantastic location and the staff were all friendly and helpful. They made some great recommendations for dinner. The room was lovely and tastefully done with nice touches each day such as the turn down service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichardTroon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful 2 night stay at the Elysees Regencia. The location was perfect for the main Paris attractions. The room we had was great -on the top floor, which meant is was very quiet. We were also upgraded to a larger room, which had a balcony overlooking the Paris streets. The Hotel reception staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. It was very nice to have L'Occitane products for our use. We would definately recommend this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best!”
Reviews.Author: iilucky
Reviews.Content: We spent the Christams break through New Years here in the top floor suite. What can I say. Everything was perfect. It was as if we had our own personal Parisian apartment just a hop off of the Champs Elysees. We were surprised by just how close we were to everything, from the subway stops to the main avenue and right between Lido two blocks away and Crazy Horse and Alma bridge in the other direction. The staff was friendly, polite, and bent over backwards to please. And if you are tempted splurge on the massage in the basement alcove, what a treat! Plus soft candlelight, rose petals, and a hot cup of tea to chase away the sore muscles from the many miles we must have walked enjoying our Parisian getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: whenever12
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fab. Stayed for my 30th with 3 other friends and got upgraded to a deluxe room Excellent location and although our room over looked the main road it wasn't too noisy Only downside was no radio/cd/i-pod docking station which would finish this hotel off

Reviews.Title: “book it!”
Reviews.Author: 3fussytravellers
Reviews.Content: The BEST location, above average plush rooms, lovely staff - it was a great deal for us (3 single travellers - we even got upgraded! THANK YOU!!!) and we loved our stay. I won't post any pictures - as you can trust the hotel pictures...in fact in real life they may even be nicer! The rooms are exceedingly clean and the staff helpful. (We booked direct with the hotel by the way, they were very efficient and gave us a better deal than I could find on the web). Don't be afraid to book here, even the smallest rooms are great. Breakfast was DELICIOUS, and with so much choice it was hard to stop eating! Sure Paris is a tad noisy (and most of it's hotel rooms are), but I have to give this lovely little hotel a glowing report from a rather fussy traveller!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Paris!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: susanPerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: Well where do I start our week in Paris...we arrived at the hotel after a long haul flight with a 6 & 7 year old in tow and some anticipation after reading all the fantastic tripadvisor reviews on this place. We were not dissapointed. We booked a family room which consisted of two bedrooms on the fourth floor. Both rooms had recently been refurbished and were very large and modern by Parisian standards or world standards for that matter. Very clean, great beds, all modcons and fantastic bath products, even a dvd player for the kids to watch movies. The hotel is in the best location, within 5 mins to the Champes Elysee Eiffel tower and the Arc de Triomphe.The breakfast which is served in the cellar of the hotel provided lots of variety and was better than anywhere else around for brekky. We also ate several dinners from room service having little ones and being tired from touring all day ourselves and have to say room service was sensational! The hotel uses the surrounding restaurants to cook the meals - nothing is cooked inhouse except breakfast - loved the duck! makes my mouth water just thinking about it. The staff went out of their way to accomodate our every whim including a night out they booked for our 10 year wedding anniversary to Lasserre. Lasserre is one of the highly rated michelan star restaurants in Paris and as such was amazing. Watching the wait staff here was like watching a ballet! The roof opens to the stars about every half hour which was also amazing. Food and Champagne were tremendous! We can also recommend the hop on hop off bus that stops at all the museums and sights and gives a great guided tour of the city and its history. We went to Disney for a day. Very easy just a 35 minute train ride away from a metro that is 5 mins walk away from the hotel and Disney is attached to the train station. I loved Paris and the hotel we chose. The staff and accomodation were amazing up to 5* standards. Book this hotel you won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute!”
Reviews.Author: beebopalu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 'Hotel Elysees Regencia' in Paris for 4 nights just before Christmas, and we had a fantastic time. The hotel location is perfect, just a 5 min walk from the Champs Elysees and there are plenty of trendy bars and restaurants nearby. The hotel decor was stylish and our room was beautifully decorated in shades of green and brown. Unlike some other reviews on TripAdvisor we found our room to be spacious (especially considering we were in Paris) The bathroom had a fantastic shower and girls: the lighting and mirrors are great for putting make-up on! The staff at this hotel really made it a special weekend for us, because they were so helpful and friendly. They arranged a special room package for us prior to our arrival which included candles, music, fruit, champagne, roses etc... We have stayed in some beautiful hotels but 'Hotel Elysees Regencia' really stood out from them all!!! We will be back.....very soon hopefully!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aj3252
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent 4 nights at this hotel and were so happy with our stay! The staff was so pleasent and always willing to help. The location couldn't be any better. Extremely recommended especially for romantic getaways!

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: beemster
Reviews.Content: The Regencia is without any doubt one of the most inspiring hotel experiences we ever had. The property is beautiful, well maintained and the staff really does everything to please your every need. We absolutely recommend this amazing place.

Reviews.Title: “Wife's 40th Birthday Treat”
Reviews.Author: WolverhamptonProv
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise for my wife's 40th Birthday. The hotel were excellent with dealing with lots of requests for help prior to our stay. We stayed in the junior suite it was a fantastic room which we both loved. The hotel was in an ideal location close to the Arc De Triomphe Champs Elysees & Eiffel Tower. The hotel and it's staff ensured that My wife's birthday was a memorable experience. The best memory was the eiffel tower twinkling like a giant christmas tree.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DrNV
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what Tripadvisor is all about! We chose this place because of its high rating and the staff went out of their way to ensure they maintained it. The hotel is less than 5 mins walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the Seine. Its a small place but the rooms are beautifully appointed with modern decor and most importantly its very clean. The reception staff were so accomodating and made our stay very special. They even moved us to another room when my girlfriend requested a 'green' themed room that she'd seen on their website!! Thank you to all the Elysees Regencia staff who made our stay so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Elysees”
Reviews.Author: shelIreland
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed here for two nights.I booked it through Venere.com after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor website.We had never been to Paris before and hadnt a clue about location of anything etc so we were a bit afraid when booking the hotel,however we had NOTHING to worry about!the Elysees is a fantastic hotel,in the perfect location!Literally 5min walk to The Champs Elysees,and about 10 mins if not less to the Eiffel Tower.The hotel itself is gorgeous,the reception area very classy,i can speak highly enough of the receptionists.Very good English and sooo helpfull!!The room we booked was a "Double deluxe room" and that it was!Room large size with large balcony overylookin the street (Room 55),dark wooden floors,huge bed!!Large bathroom with lots of lovely L'occitane products!A ketle,hairdryer,tv,mini-bar,all the mod-cons,just perfect for a romantic stay close to all ammenities!!would recommend it to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend”
Reviews.Author: Quickie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a small hotel located centrally in Paris for sightseeing and were delighted with this charming hotel. As said in other reviews, the staff spoke excellent English, were always polite and friendly and gave good advice on things to see and places to eat. The room was smallish but very well laid out and immaculately clean and the bed was really comfortable. I assume the hotel was refurbished not long ago. It is a few minutes walk from both the Seine, Metro stations and the Arc de Triomph, where we happened to see President Sarkozy on Remembrance Sunday. The satellite TV had some UK channels. Our room looked out onto a quiet street and the only noise came from church bells. We would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone planning to eat out a lot as we did - the only meals available are breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bonne Regencia!”
Reviews.Author: JPBoyle
Reviews.Content: We also celebrated our 10th wedding aniversary in Paris at the Elysees Regencia. The hotel was very nice and ideal for a special / romantic weekend. The staff were always helpful and polite and the location is good, convenient and only a short walk from the Metro. We didn't eat there at all so can't comment on the food as there are just too many nice restaurants to explore in Paris. Would certainly recommend this hotel, you won't be disappointed . Although a little expensive we thought it was worth the money. You get what you pay for! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mazpaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September and travelled from London on the Eurostar. A wonderful way to travel, such a relaxing way to arrive. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and the hotel had helped my husband arrange champers in the room, candles and beautiful rose petals everywhere. Very romantic. I could not fault the hotel - the staff are very polite and helpful and service is very good. The hotel is old but with modern facilities. Very French (as you would expect) and very chic. The rooms are very comfortable and clean and the products are all L'OCCITANE so if you are a fan of these wonderful products you are in luck. On checkout I even received a lovely L'OCCITANE gift (yes brownies points from me) You can have breakfast in the room (which was lovely) but its also nice to have it downstairs in the cellar. Good quality and Good variety. Anniversary night we dined in Le Masion Blanc, recommended by the hotel. They were very helpful in booking and giving suggestions. This had an truly amazing panoramic floodlit view over the city and is a romantic setting ...but it was very expensive, you were paying a premium for the view and ambience. (Thankfully my menu didn’t have prices on it, the gentleman pays..... I’m not sure how politically correct this is but I wasn’t complaining :) All in all. If you want a romantic weekend in Paris - Check out Hotel Elysees Regencia Paris

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Loopylu77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so lovely. We stayed here for 5 nights on our honeymoon. It was just right. It is nice and central and so easy to get around, but it was lovely and quiet too. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. They spoke perfect English, and assisted us with whatever we needed. We had breakfast in bed one day and although it may seem expensive, you get so much food and it is all delicious - so great for a treat. The room was great, so clean and a nice size. The colour scheme throughout the hotel is nice and modern, but with a warm touch. The bathroom was fab, lovely toiletries and comfy robes. I think we booked a superior room. They come in standard, superior or deluxe. If you have a look at the hotels website, what you see on there is what you get. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Paulo_Almeida
Reviews.Content: Paris was the first stop during our honeymoon. The hotel choice turned out to be very good. The hotel is very well located, the staff is very friendly and the rooms, considering that we are in Paris, are very good. The standard room in which we stayed is a small but very nice room. The photos speak for the room. We chose the standard room because we were not planning to spend that much time in the room, since there is so much too see in Paris and always so little time (we reserved that part to the second stop of our honeymoon). The is well located, clean, friendly and a choice to be considered everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dreamingofsun0607
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely two night stay at this delightful property. From the moment we arrived the staff were polite and gave us a lovely welcome. The corridors and spiral staircases were a vision in red! The room was gorgeously decorated in neutral shades accented with green with a big comfortable bed, stripped wooden floors and a clean spacious bathroom with a selection of L'Occitane toiletries. OK - so the view won't win any prizes but it's location couldn't be handier. In one direction it's a ten minute stroll to the Seine and the Bateaux Mouches. In the opposite direction L'Arc de Triomphe stands gloriously proud at the top of the street - a gateway to the Champs Elysees and all it has to offer. The crowning glory of our stay was on departure, when we were presented with a box of L'Occitane toiletries and a handwritten note from the manager hoping to see us soon. I certainly think they will!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: IMB-Cheshire
Reviews.Content: We spent my birthday at the Hotel Elysees Regencia in Paris and it is truly amazing. A comtemporary boutique with lots of style. The staff were brilliant and very accommodating and I couldn't have wished to stay at a nicer place. The location wasn't fantastic as we struggled to find many good places to eat, but the hotel itself was faultless. Comfortable, sparkling clean, classy and funky in every way. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Botique Hotel In Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ginalds
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about this property. The rooms are clean, well decorated, comfortable beds; the staff is very friendly and accommodating with all needs. Excellent at dinner recommendations and general information. Loved the free internet service in the lobby. We arrived much earlier than normal check-in and the hotel was able to provide a room right away. One important note is that the rooms don't seem to have a clock, so it would be a good idea to bring a travel clock.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiggertime
Reviews.Content: The worst thing about our stay at this hotel was that it was only 3 nights, not long enough. This small botique hotel is in an excellent location. The staff are very good. Our room on the 6th floor (the junior suite) was fabulous. We have stayed at hundreds of hotels around the world and I cannot ever remember enjoying a room any more than this one. It was just about perfect. A building next door blocking much of the view of the eiffel tower was the only thing not perfect about the room. We would stay here again in a second. Highly recommended. Oh, one minor complaint. The wi-fi system throughout the hotel needs work, it never really worked correctly. I am told they are changing companies/upgrading wi fi connections. A minor detail.

Reviews.Title: “i love paris in the springtime!!”
Reviews.Author: jayne777
Reviews.Content: we stayed here over the easter weekend and can honestly say this was the best easter ever! the hotel is in a great location, being right in between the arc de triomphe and eiffel tower, and only 5 mins walk to the champs elysees. when we arrived the room wasn't quite ready, so the staff gave us a seat in the lobby and brought us tea, which was lovely. we were taken to the room only 15 mins later, and wow what a room. it was a pretty big room, especially for central paris, and very well decorated and clean. the bathroom was also well done out and a decent size. the view from our french (of course!) window was of the street out the front, but we weren't at all bothered by any traffic noise. on our last night we came back to the room to find a lovely hand written note from the manager saying they hoped we enjoyed the stay and there was a little box of l'occitane goodies which was a very nice touch. the reception staff were all extremely helpful, and their english far better than my feeble attempts at french! on the same street there is a deli called noura, which sells some of the nicest chocolates i've ever had, and the metro station georges v is only 5 mins walk away. i honestly cant recommend the hotel highly enough, and would definitely saty there again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: chris_underscore
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was small but amazing, every little detail, I really like the French style. It had free internet, very nice front desk people, who spoke english very well, It was set in such a great area, a couple minutes walk to the Champs Elysee, So we had dinner there every night. The Architecture of the building was amazing, the rooms were very modern. I would go there everytime I go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Elysees Regencia Paris”
Reviews.Author: babydix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for 5 nights during the month of August we were very satisfied. I booked it based on all the good reviews on TripAdvisor and was not dissapointed. The hotel is super clean (I'm super picky about that) and the nicely decorated. Very small room, but I think that is average in Europe. The staff was very nice and helpful, they guided us on how to get around in the city, metro, places to go and nice restaurants. They booked reservations for us to shows and for dinners and more importantly, they were fluent in English. This hotel was a very good choice, the price was excellent for the type of hotel and for the location. They also gave me a small gift before I left.

Reviews.Title: “small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: fredhilll
Reviews.Content: we, as a family of 4, stayed at this hotel recently. It is a lovely hotel. we had a "suite",consisting of two rooms at the end of the hallway that we could close off from a door in the hallway. Each room was lovely and quite spacious. The L'occtitane products are a wonderful touch. Personally I prefer a larger hotel that has a workout faciltybut we were only here for three nights. The location was great...a short walk to the metro, Arc de Triumphe and Champs D'Ellysees. The staff was very accomodating also. Unfortunately for us it was very rainy while we were there so we did not wander the neighborhood much. There is a grocery store around the corner and a bakery that had fresh croissants and such daily. all in all I would recommend this hotel. It is true to the photos.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and well located”
Reviews.Author: themorrisman
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on other Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. We stayed for four nights to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary so chose a Double DeLuxe room. Paris hotel rooms are criticised for being small but this was not the case here, with a king sized bed, clearly two sizeable singles that had been joined, that was almost too big! The room looked as though it had come directly out of the Hotel's own website and came with coffee making facilities, as well as the usual mini-bar, and it also boasted a good quality flat screen TV. The en-suite was excellent with small details that added to the experience, but a second bathrobe would have been nice. Although on the busy Ave. Marceau our room at the front on the 5th floor was quiet, and even the air-con, at minimum, was not noisy. We had booked through Venere.com, which was very efficient and gave a reasonable price. Breakfast was 12euros but good value. The desk staff were pleasant and spoke good English, there was even a laptop available close to reception that allowed us access to emails - free of charge! The location was great, 5-10 mins from the metro, arc de triomphe, champs elysees and seine and 20mins from the eiffel tower. In all a great experience and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: -Bandy07
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a special birthday trip and chose it mainly for its location - 10 mins walk from the Arc de Triomphe, 5 mins from Champs Elysees - and after reading favourable reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. It was everything we'd hoped for and more; wonderful staff, very clean, modern and well serviced. Bathrobes and good quality toiletries gave it a nice, luxurious feel and there were some lovely touches like the fresh rose petals on the towels each day and the handwritten note from the manager on our departure day thanking us for our stay. The room wasn't huge but didn't need to be and wasn't lacking because of this. If we returned to Paris we would definitely choose to stay here again and would recommend to anyone looking for a boutique style hotel. We really couldn't find any faults!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BC4323
Reviews.Content: I normally do not write reviews but felt compelled to since I use this site so regularlly and this hotel was fantastic. My wife and I stayed here in July and had a great time. The hotel is in a perfect location, off the major streets but close to everything. You can walk or take the metro anywhere in a matter of minutes. Our room was vvery large for Paris (stayed in a Junior Suite) and the hotel staff was very friendly and courteous. I spent days and hours researching locations and I was very pleased with our choice............Cant go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lola0
Reviews.Content: We are just back from staying at this hotel for three nights. We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Elysees Regencia. The hotel is tastefully decorated and has very modern decor. The rooms are small but have everything you need and are impecably decorated. The rooms are very clean and well stocked with towels, toiletries, slippers and bathrobes. Upon arrival the staff were very welcoming and spoke very good english. They were very helpful throughout our stay offering advice and even providing print out maps with directions. The breakfast was lovely- however we felt perhaps a bit pricey at €18 per head. Having said that- we would highly recommend staying at this hotel- clean, modern, great location and wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel”
Reviews.Author: elaineylcheng
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel! very clean. receptionists very friendly and helpful! excellent service. love the location of the hotel as well. very easily accessible to anywhere in the city. will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DestinationMoon
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I wanted to visit Paris, and when I couldn't get into a few hotels recommended by friends, I decided to take a chance with the TripAdvisor reviewers. They and the hotel did not dissappoint! We stayed for over a week, probably longer than the average stay. The room was kept clean, with fresh towels, and the bed was even turned down most nights. I particularly liked the ability to control the air conditioning by thermostat in my room. Probably their most special asset is the front desk staff - always cheerful and helpful. After a few days my daughter kept commenting how she felt we were going "home" to our place in Paris. They have an odd system of making you turn in the front desk key when you leave, but we never had to wait to hand it in or retrieve it. The front desk also sells the two or four day Paris Museum Pass, which I highly recommend for adults in order to bypass long lines at the popular places. Our room did overlook the Avenue Marceu, which I was somewhat concerned about because of the noise experience from other reviewers. We did hear some noise, but most of the time we had no trouble sleeping - sometimes until 10 am. The room has a small safe, which was big enough to hold my 12" laptop with other items. There is free WiFi in the lobby only (but it will sometimes reach the rooms), and one free laptop permanently in the lobby which was usually available. I was able to print my return boarding passes by saving a pdf to a USB drive and taking it to the front desk (they will lend you one if needed). The location is great - not next to anything particular but in the middle of everything if you don't mind walking and taking the Metro or RER. The only time we took a taxi was to and from the airport (we had heavy luggage for a long stay). It was about a 5 minute walk to the Champs where we could catch the Metro, or a 10 minute walk down Marceu and across the bridge for the RER to Versailles. I am sure the hotel management watches TripAdvisor like hawks, so I will make a few minor suggestions. Some type of chest of drawers or even shelves would be nice, as I wound up having to leave small/folded items in my suitcase. An alarm clock radio in the room would be useful. Also, why not just make the Wifi available for free throughout the hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: Gupti
Reviews.Content: The Elysees Regencia Hotel is absolute paradise. I went there recently, and as a young couple we had the most amazing experience in The Regencia from start to finish. The staff first are wonderful and cater for every request and need that may arise, from advice, reservations and questions nothing is too much hassle. The room was on the fifth floor with two small balconies, newly refurbished and very stylish. Location is very nice, literally five minutes walk to the Champs Elysees, fifteen mins to Eiffel Tower and Louvre etc. I cannot recommend this hotel enough and I will definately be back when I return to paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel028
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and boy was I scared. I had heard all the rumors about Paris not being very friendly to Americans. We had made arrangement to be picked up at the airport by the hotel and it made our arrival flawless. The driver spoke English and the vehicle had plenty of room. The hotel appears just as it does in their pictures. It was very charming. Everyone spoke English except maybe the breakfast waitress but it didn't really matter. It's a buffet and there was little need for talking. The room was very comfortable as well as beautiful. The location is perfect. If I ever come to Paris again, I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Everything the high ratings indicate! Perfect for first-time Paris.”
Reviews.Author: amplio
Reviews.Content: I recently spent the weekend of July 28, 29 2007 in the Hotel Elysees Regencia. I stayed at this hotel because of the high TripAdvisor ratings and I was not disappointed. The Regencia is everything positive that is written about it in the reviews and the high popularity ratings are well deserved. Quality: The rooms are all tastefully decorated in a contemporary style with high quality furnishings. All the pictures on their website are accurate. The rooms all appear recently refurbished and everything appears new. Beds are comfortable with new linens. Bathrooms appear new and immaculate. Rooms are small by US standards, but large by Paris standards. Staff: The staff all spoke excellent English and were very helpful and accommodating. There was none of the legendary Paris attitude. In fact, I never saw this my entire time in France and I don't speak French. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and offer any assistance and also made me feel very welcomed and relaxed. Location: 5 minute walk to Champs- Elysee and Arc de Triumph as well as George V Metro station. 20 minute walk to Eiffel Tower. This is the perfect location for first time Paris visitors looking to do the tourist activities as there are lots of tourists and restaurants on this end of the Champs Elysee. 10 minute walk to the Air France bus stop providing easy and cheap transportation to CDG airport. Recommend red tour bus (Les Cars Rouge) for sightseeing combined with Metro. The tour bus stop is near the Arc de Triumph on the Champs Elysees. Price: Paid 190 Euros per night for a standard single (full) bed room. This was a good value for the area, especially for such a high quality hotel. Miscellaneous: Room safe large enough to hold widescreen laptop. Wifi internet service was spotty, but free, as I believe I was picking up the lobbies free access point from the fourth floor. Paid WiFi internet service is available. The 18 Euro Regencia breakfast via room service was excellent and is sufficient to feed two people. There appeared to be mostly American couples and families in the hotel. This was my first time in Paris, so I had to trust fellow TripAdvisors on this hotel. I truly enjoyed this hotel and will stay there again on my next visit. I slept until 12:00 PM one day as the bed and room were so comfortable. Im sure there are other great hotels in Paris; however, in terms of quality, location and value -along with good TripAdvisor referrals, it’s hard to beat the Elysees Regencia. Please contact me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Compline
Reviews.Content: Elysees Regencia is an absolutely fab hotel - perfectly proportioned and positioned for a romanic trip to Paris. Ask them about Birthday Packages 1, 2 etc. Rose petals and music. Much fun and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and a Great value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: drsoul
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Europe that was both last minute and for both business and pleasure. As it was booked last minute, and it has been a while since I leisure-traveled in Paris and London (and, thus, chose my own accommodations), I decided to give the TripAdvisor community a test with my money by selecting, based on the reviews and comments here, my hotel in both of these places. My review of The Parkcity in London appears elsewhere. The Hotel Elysees Regencia Paris lived up to, and actually exceeded, my expectations. The staff was extremely communicative, from confirming my reservation to setting up transfer to and from the airport; providing me with restaurant reccomendations; assistance with booking reservations; as well as subway directions to nightclubs, attractions, and said restaurants. I found all of the staff to be quite friendly and patient with my merely okay French. All of their communication was in English, and though I apologized for my poor French, it was unnecessary. They were all pleasant, informed, and able to answer questions and assist me with any issue that came up during my stay. Fortunately, no issue did arise. I was placed in a spacious, air-conditioned, Fuschia room with views of the front of the property. Although facing the street, it was quiet at night and sleeping was not a problem. The room was well-kept, turndown service provided, and contained all of the creature comforts (nice toiletries, large soaking tub, mini bar, small flat screen television, and - very important- good task lighting!) I needed. I thought the shower head was too low and ill-placed (I'm 6'2"), but otherwise the bathroom was great. I also never heard any noises or sounds from other rooms, and the property was fully committed my entire four days there. I did not have the breakfast (it's not included), but may do so when I return. I also did not try their massage services. They have wifi capabilities in the lobby, and a computer for checking email and web browsing. There are also several comfortable sitting areas (non smoking) and a bar for coffee and drinks that I found most pleasant. Overall, the property is a real value - close to several top attractions, and a short walk from the subway. The one thing that was, I don't know, troublesome, was that the place was probably 80+% filled with English speaking travelers. This shouldn't be a problem for me, but it did take away from the feeling I have when traveling abroad and hearing the language and soaking up the flavor of the country I'm visiting. I also felt like we were all sheep following the great tripadvsor reviews. And I guess we all were. I highly recommend this property for both business and pleasure travelers and will return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CherHote
Reviews.Content: Although small by American standards, the room was fantastic and clean, and a good size for Paris. A true luxury boutique! Our A/C was not working upon arrival, but the staff promptly fixed it when they were informed of the problem. We stayed here for 5 days in July and loved it. An added plus: L'Occitane bath products and a marble bathroom. I would highly recommend this place for the price (about 200 euro per night)- and I'm VERY discerning when it comes to cleanliness and quality...

Reviews.Title: “In Luv”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel269
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at this amazing boutique type hotel. Everything was great from the staff, room size, a/c, bathroom (with a nice type of roses petals on your towel); turndown service when out of the room early enough. The hotel is in a great location just a few minutes work to Champs-Elysees where you can find a place to eat, and the seine river when you have this wonderful view of the Eiffel tower. A positive thing is that you aren’t far from the metro. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Rated #1 in my book!”
Reviews.Author: QueenBMM
Reviews.Content: As a family of five (grandmother, mother and three teenage daughters), we stayed here the first week of July for four nights based on reports from this website. We had two family connecting rooms which were perfect – giving the girls some privacy. I believe we had rooms 26 & 27 – one had a small balcony. They were spacious, quiet and exceptionally clean. The hotel is situated in a very safe area – extremely important for us females – and the staff is top notch. The hotel is small enough that the staff know you by name, don’t hesitate to meet your needs and even seem to anticipate your desires. They were very attentive and even one of our girls who is very shy felt comfortable at this hotel and with the staff. She gave the greatest compliment – she said when she returns to Paris on her own, she will stay here! The staff assisted us in securing taxis, tickets and transportation to/from a show, and transportation to the train station. Everything they set us up with was perfect! Even before we arrived at the hotel, we had a special request to hold invitations to a special fashion show (could only be mailed to a Paris address) and they didn’t hesitate to accommodate us. When we walked in and announced who we were, they immediately presented the mail for us – we didn’t even have to ask. I just can’t say enough positive things about this staff. The hotel is well maintained – even though the elevator was out of commission for a short period of time one afternoon, they immediately had someone working on it and it was fixed. Location, location, location – GREAT as others have said. I agree with my daughter, when I return to Paris, this is where I will stay!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for first trip”
Reviews.Author: sarahrn095
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 5day trip from Paris. This was the first trip to Paris for me and my husband. This hotel was perfect for our needs. The hotel is 2 blocks away from champ elysees which was perfect. The arc de triumphe is up the street, Walk down the street there's the river with views of the eiffel tower. And several metro stops close by. The hotel itself is very charming and modern. We stayed in a double room rm 57 which was at the end of a hallway and very quiet at night. (although it faced marceau ave) The room had a small terrace and modern bath with shower. Seriously we had no complaints. We never had breakfast here I think it was 18 euros for continental breakfast we would walk to one of the many cafes and eat there.and take in the atmosphere. The staff is helpful and they speak english. Service is adequate. It's France so your not doted on. We would definitley stay here again. For a reasonable price we felt like we got a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KimbersSB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights in a standard room and had a wonderful time. The staff was incredible, housekeeping kept the room perfect with rose petals and chocolates on the bed nightly. The L'Occitane products were delightful. Room 62 is a blue room-my husband wasn't that jazzed about being surrounded by pink and annise, with a window that overlooks the street. The staff recommended an Italian restaurant called IL Sardo a few blocks from the hotel and it was the best meal of our trip. I would recommend a reservation for dinner which is at 9.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: glaciertravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel in the beginning of July. We are a family of 4 and booked the blue suite on the top floor. We felt this was a real bargain. Excellent location for little feets (4 and 8) since we walked quite much to the near attraction. Housekeeping needs special recognition - the room was spotless, and turndown service excellent . When we arrived the first night the bed-sofa was ready for the girls with treats. Realy nice gesture. They were very impressed by the rose pedals for the bath (real ones!) and loved taking a bath in the big bathtub. The bathroom was really effective as a family of 4 got prepaired for bed - one in the shower, one using the wc and 2 brushing their theeth - all at the same time :-) We had roomservice for breakfast (no extra charge for roomservice) and thought the selection and price was reasonable. We also went to the breakfastroom in the basement and got excellent service. All in all this is a very good hotel, central location, excellent service by staff and they can proudly boost their 4 * I am most happy to reccomend it for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: barrera
Reviews.Content: Long weekend in Paris - booked in here. Location wise, pretty hard to beat - Arc De Triomphe 5 mins walk one way, Tour Eiffel 10 mins walk the other way. Staff v helpful, room small but v clean, and nice TV (important!). Bathroom area seriously cool. We also loved the bar in the hotel, great for a nightcap after an evening out. Though it's hard to imagine that it's one of the very top 2 or 3 hotels in ALL of Paris as Tripadvisor ranks, it is a hotel I'd have no problem staying in again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in a perfect, central location”
Reviews.Author: Lucyc55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend in April, and I can't recommend it highly enough. The location couldn't be better. It is unbelievably central - just off the Arc de Triumph - but the street where it is located is not too noisy, so you are not kept awake at night. The staff spoke impecable English and were very helpful when we asked for restaurant recommendations, and were happy to make reservations for us. The rooms were a little on the small side, but not uncomfortabley so. If we had been staying any longer, I would definately upgrade to a larger room though. They were, however, spotlessly clean, and contained everything you could possibly need. Overall, I can't recommend this hotel highly enough, and I will definately be staying there next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Peleto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our first weekend away alone since our son was born nearly two years ago and loved our stay in this hotel. The hospitable welcome (and tolerance for my bad French) set the tone for the way in which we were treated by all staff the whole weekend. Initially, we had planned to stay in another hotel we love that has a similar contemporary and boutiquey feel which is nearer to Le Marais - an area we love - but we couldn't get in. As we always do, we consulted Trip Advisor and found this gem of a place. It lived up to its 'good press', and even exceeded my expectations. The room was great: bigger than average for Paris, on the fourth floor and with a balconette off both the french doors in the bedroom and bathroom. The decoration was modern and simple - dark brown wood and bright pink accents - the room was light and airy and the bed was comfortable. It also over-looked a back street, so it was quiet. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in this area or Paris, or perhaps first-timers - it is good value for money and in a 'nice' part of Paris near many major attractions. We will definitely put this Hotel on our list of places to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Truly spectacular!!”
Reviews.Author: LA-Elvis
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent two weeks in Europe druing May 2007 celebrating his 21st birthday. Our first stop was the Elysees Regencia and it could not have been better. While some people have noted that the hotel is pricey, for Paris and for the value of what is received at this hotel, I believe it is an absolute bargain, and I have stayed at fine hotels around the world. The room felt as though it was brand new, everything in perfect condition and completely spotless. The furnishings in the room were very upscale, including beautiful wood floors and lovely furniture. All service in the hotel was at the highest level and very personal. We quickly became known to all of the front desk staff and they were helpful, friendly and wonderful in every way. The hotel is in an older structure but completely restored and modernized so it is the best of both worlds. We overlooked the street through two big beautiful windows and the street is tree lined so we looked onto that which was great. The location is perfect as noted in a number of other reviews, close to many things and close to transportation to things that aren't close. I agree with at least one other review that the shower is odd with the placement of the shower head and I am 6 feet 5 inches so it is probably a bigger issue for me than most, but this is an extremely minor item and in no way would discourage me from staying there again. This is the only hotel I would look into for my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: CMTMaui_HI
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review for sometime now... and here it is. My husband and I stayed in the Lavender Suite during our wedding week in 2006 and it was a fantastic experience. We got married at a Sofitel in Paris but this was our home base. It is in a great neighborhood close to great restaurants, cafes and activities on foot or by metro. The staff was friendly and very welcoming, they sent us flowers on the night we got married!! Overall this was such a great hotel we will return when we make it back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rostogol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week at the beginning of June and we were quite impressed. First of all, location is excellent – 5 minutes from the Champs-Elysées and from Charles V tube station. Katrin in Reception greeted us - she was absolutely amazing throughout our stay. Although we were early (10am) our room was ready within half an hour and we were offered a complimentary cup of tea. The room was spacious for Paris standards, beautiful and spotless and the toiletries were nice as well – L’Occitane. We had breakfast at the hotel once – it was good, but nothing special for the price – like many other members, I think it should have been included in the price of the room, which was quite high. The nice gift and hand-written message from the manager we found on the bed during our last evening made a difference as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great laid back hotel”
Reviews.Author: bladerama
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paris and a stay at this great hotel. A really chilled out atmosphere, backed up by really knowledgable staff. The rooms are well laid out, excelle nt use of space and great decor. I had organised some champagne to be in the room, which it was along with rose petals, a hand written note and a little MP3 player playing some nice music. They do things well at this hotel, so if you are going for a special occasion, let them know, you are in good hands here and I would really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very niceplace to stay”
Reviews.Author: nbdoc
Reviews.Content: We did find all the positives in this hotel that previous reviewers described, and had overall a very good stay there. I want specifically mention the hotel staff, who could not have been more pleasant and helpful at everything from booking tours to cleaning rooms. Now about some negatives: I traveled with my wife and 21 year old daughter. We booked the room for three, the smallest one the hotel's web site allowed. The room was tiny, probably OK for 2 people, but when the third bed was brought in, one could not move around the room. It certainly was innapropriate to sell this room for three people. I did mention it to the front desk. To the credit of the staff, next day we were relocated into the larger room, which was of much more reasonable size wothout extra charge. I agree that for the price we paid, breakfast could have been included. The breakfast was not the greatest, and overpriced. If you only eat bread and croissants, it's E12, but if you grab a piece of cheese - it's 18.Finally ( a small thing) - access to the web is free from their PC, or from your PC in the lobby, but in e room you have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the very heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: MrsMeeks
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I travelled to Paris for our 2nd wedding anniversary and as this was our first time here, we decided to choose a hotel near the centre and book an upgrade to a deluxe room as a treat. After a traumatic journey (flight delays, problems on metro etc) we eventually arrived at the hotel. From the outside it is very pretty indeed, with flower baskets in bloom spilling out over a beautiful façade. Once inside the hotel is very calm and very modern, a real oasis from the busy main road out front. We were greeted in English, very quickly checked in and on our way up the small lift to our room which was on the 4th floor. I just have to say that the halls and stairs are really nicely done, very modern but mixing so easily with the obvious age of the hotel. We were in Room 45 (one of the green rooms) and were very pleased with the whole feel of it. I have been told that most rooms in Paris are very small which is why we booked an upgrade and it was worth every penny. Pristine white sheets, a MASSIVE bed, very comfortable pillows, plenty of storage space, a flat screen TV with English channels, Tea making facilities and two HUGE windows which opened out on the street below. The bathroom was wonderful too, very modern and classy, with an excellent supply of toiletries and extras that go towards making you feel so special. There were also robes and slippers provided as well as clean towels every day. The shower was the only slight odd thing as it was over the centre of the bath and not very high up so my hubby had a bit of bother as he is over 6ft. The room was serviced every day and turned down at night with little chocolates on your pillow which I am sure is the expected but for me was lovely. The hotel is 5mins at the most from the Champs Elysees, the River Seine and the Arc de Triomphe so is exceptionally situated for a short break. The only issue I had was the traffic outside the hotel, the road is very very busy but I suppose that is Paris for you and nothing that can be done about it – the windows are pretty good at blocking it if you keep them closed! We didn’t take up the Breakfast option, as it isn’t cheap and Paris is so full of little cafes that serve wonderful coffee, fresh pastries and eggs that it is much more fun to go out and eat. We did have a drink in the hotel bar, which was quite reasonable and the service was exceptional (the service for everything in the Hotel was exceptional). All in all, it is perfect for a City Break, where you want to be in the thick of things, aren’t bothered about busy roads and streets and want a little bit of luxury as well. We would definitely return to the Hotel Elysees Regencia if we were only in Paris for a couple of days, if you are coming for a longer period of time I would advise staying in the outskirts and travelling in to see the sights as it is much quieter and cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “marvelous stay”
Reviews.Author: peter_SFSanFrancisc0
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Hotel Elysees Regencia and we had a marvelous stay. Its location in the right bank near the champs elysees and the eiffel tower was just perfect... the service we received was wonderful. The front desk staff was incredible helping us out in every way they could. Their help and recommendations were right on !!! The accomodations were better than we anticipated -- tastefully decorated, beds were very comfortable, hairdryer, a safe, and the bathroom was roomy and very clean. We just loved the well being massage we had in a very zen atmosphere. Breakfast was good and plentiful ; we had champagne ans smoked salmon !!! We would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time”
Reviews.Author: xsophx
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing!! This was my mums 4th time at this hotel, and my 2nd, and we are going to go again for sure. The room was a really good size and the staff were really friendly. I would totally recommentd this hotel. The breakfast was lovely and the staff were willing to do anything for us, from booking a restaurant from us, to ringing the airport and seeing if our flight has a delay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Should include breakfast at these prices”
Reviews.Author: claudio10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights accommodation only.The hotel is on a road directly behind the Champs Elysees so location is excellent. Our room was on the small side but was modern with very comfortable beds, a nice t v and a nice bathroom which has L'occitane toiletries which are a nice addition. Breakfast is an extra 18 euros per person so we opted to visit a cafe. We felt the hotel should definitely include breakfast at these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JuicyinLondon
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a short holiday at the Elysees Regencia. Friendly staff, clean, spacious bed/washroom, super location. Wireless in room is rather slow, make use of the common use computer in the lobby if you are not on business. Breakfast not included and rather expensive - head to nearby Paul on Champs-Elysees or Bert's Cafe Contemporarian near the Seine.

Reviews.Title: “Love And Paris”
Reviews.Author: botham2084
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three day break in Paris at the Elysees Regencia. First thoughts....WOW! The hotel was exactly as it appears on its website, it's absolutely beautiful. We made our own way to the hotel after flying into CDG. We got the RER at a cost of €32 return and found it very easy despite getting a little disorientated at Gare De Nord. We took the train from CDG to Gare De Nord then from Gare De Nord to Chatelet Les Halles on the 'D' Line where we changed on to the 'A' line to Charles De Galle Etoille. From here we encountered the Arc De Triomphe and found that our hotel was on the exact opposite side from the RER station, just a 5 minute walk from the Champs Elysees. The hotel was in the most perfect location. Literally one street from the Champs Elysees and at the bottom of the road and across the river was the Eiffel Tower. You could not ask for a better location to explore the city and to top it off, the weather was glorious. The room was clean and spacious and absolutely gorgeous. The bathroom was fantastic with huge white fluffy towels and bathrobes. The mini-bar was well stocked but expensive. The bed.....well, probably the comfiest bed we have ever slept in! What really made the hotel outstanding was the special touches such as the L'Occitane products on our bed on our last night with a handwritten note from the manager saying she hoped we enjoyed our stay. Each night we came back to the hotel to find our bed had been turned down and the curtain closed ready for us. We were given clean towels twice a day and the bins were emptied daily. This hotel is a real classic boutique hotel. If you are going to Paris, stay in this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: oliversmum
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and professional. It is nice to stay in smaller hotels as you receive a more personal service. We stayed in the lavender suite - room 10 and it was lovely. The only negative was the windows were obscured so you could not see out, nor could you open them. The large roll top bath in the room was lovely. Breakfast was really nice but should really have been included in the price. The room and all areas were very clean. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Philleas_Fogg_uette
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nearly flawless. Great location, very nice quiet and comfortable rooms, and very helpful staff. The room decor was very fresh and modern and the room size was very satisfactory for 2 persons and their luggage (we had the standard room). Amenities were 5*, and the beds were very comfortable. Breakfast may appear expensive, but it is actually very good value. We had the 18 Euro buffet breakfast everyday, and I found the breakfast room's atmosphere very relaxing and the items offfered very fresh and nicely presented. The breakfast staff were genuinely very polite too. Reception staff were very sweet, and taxis were promptly called when requested. Only improvement I would suggest to the management is with respect to the housekeeping, which was somewhat erratic. Overall a very good experience. We would gladly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Anne1957
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights as part of my 50th birthday celebrations, based on the reviews on Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed. We went for a deluxe room, which was quite large, with a huge and very comfortable bed. We had told the hotel about my 'special birthday' and there was a half bottle of champagne and fruit in the room when we arrrived, which was a nice touch. Lovely bathroom, with fluffly robes and up-market toiletries (Occitane). Breakfast was served in the basement, which had a character all of its own! We had breakfast there on the first morning, I have to say it didn't seem very well organised. No-one told us what to do, it was unclear as which items were included in the continental breakfast, which was 12 euros, and which in the full breakfast, which was 18 euros; we were offered tea or coffee from a communal pot but no-one came to offer refills although I'm sure we could have had refills if we'd gone to find someone. We decided after that to have breakfast in the room for the other two days and that was lovely, particularly when we were given a complimentary glass of champagne and smoked salmon on the morning of my birthday! The full breakfast at 18 euros was very good value. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, especially Kathrin, who seemed to be on duty almost the whole time we were there! She speaks excellent English but I was disappointed not to use my French, as I speak it quite well - my efforts to speak in French were answered in English, so I gave up after a while! Room service was excellent - we ate in the room on the Sunday evening and had pizza and tapas, with a bottle of wine. There were a couple of minor problems, one was the total lack of drawer space in the room - there was a bit of shelf space but it was not enough, and the hanging space in the wardrobe was just about long enough for a shirt - not adequate for skirts or dresses. The furniture rather let the room down, it seemed rather cheap and basic. The other problem was the lift. There was only one, which is fair enough as there is limited space, but it broke down on the Saturday and was still not working when we left on the Monday. Being on the fifth floor, we found it quite a hike, and my husband has a heart condition (although to be fair the hotel could not have known that). Had we known the lift was unreliable, we would have asked for a room lower down. The staff were very apologetic though and did everything they could to help, they brought our cases down on the day we left. I felt very sorry for the staff member who had to carry a heavy dinner tray up from the basement on the Sunday evening. I thought the hotel was a little on the expensive side but it's in the Champs Elysees area, so that's hardly surprising; it would have been nice to have had breakfast included for what we paid, but having said that, we did get a few freebies in honour of my birthday! Just a quick word about the area - the restaurants are plentiful (except on Sunday evening, when just about EVERYTHING is closed, hence the pizza in the room!!) but they are very expensive and the ones we went to weren't particularly good either. I stayed in the Notre Dame area last year and it's much cheaper to eat there. Nice area though, fairly quiet, quite close to the metro and within easy distance of the RER.

Reviews.Title: “very nice indeed. Breakfast should be included in the price though”
Reviews.Author: frootloops
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the Hotel Elysees Regencia may 2007. Location wise it is great. 5 minute walk from l'Arc de Triomphe, 10 minutes or so from the Eifffel Tower. The room was nice and spacious, and the decor was fresh and clean. We arrived well before the specified check in time, but they were very friendly at the desk and offered us a coffee while they quickly got the room ready. The front desk were friendly and helpful. I think though that at the price we paid (approx £180 a night) breakfast should most certainly have been included (18 euro for a continental breakfast). In the immediate vicinity there are a couple of supermarkets, and lots of bakeries with amazing looking cakes.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: At the Shore in New Jersey USA
Reviews.Title: “THE BEST WEEK OF MY LIFE IN PARIS”
Reviews.Author: DaimlerBenz
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Elysees Regencia in PARIS on May 5-11th.Let me just say that this Hotel is in the PERFECT Location...One block from the Champs-Elysees,...5 minutes walk to Arc de Triomphe....At the other end of the street,is where Princess Diana Died,...15 minutes from the hotel in the other direction is Eiffel Tower....We walked all over Paris everyday for the week we were there,And i LOVED IT!! Most things are within walking distance...just wear comfortable shoes. :) The Hotel itself was Beautiful from the Outside,and very Clean and modern on the inside.I rented the Double Deluxe Room on the Fifth Floor and i was Very HAPPY.The Room had plenty of space and was very clean.Not Much storage area for your clothes,but who Cares,Your in PARIS!! We found ourselves not in the Room much at all anyways....We were out and about from early until late at night. I swear that city never sleeps :) People out very late,just enjoying the city and weather.Tried room service and the food was Great....I have no Complaints about this wonderful Hotel....The Staff is Very Friendly and Helpful and they speak Great English. I will be staying there again next year for another week. Couple of tips....Bring an alarm clock,The room didn;t have any clocks in the room,but i did recommend it to the manager when i Left....and I do not Recommend Using the PARIS SHUTTLE that is online (Parishuttle) Although they where on time when we arrived in Paris,When it was time to leave Paris to go back to the Airport...The driver was late,Then we had to pick up 4 other couples and by the time we Got to the Airport and checked in,We had to run to the gate because they were boarding our Flight.I will definitely take a taxi next time. I Wish everyone that has never been to Paris a Wonderful trip like we had....It was a week in my life that i will never forget. By the way,Don;t worry about the language barrier....Most people in Paris spoke some english. HOTEL ELYSEES REGENCIA Is Tops in my Book and i Recommend it to Everyone.....Have a great time everyone. I LOVE PARIS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Elysees Regencia -- fine hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WatersEurope
Reviews.Content: Good position, nice decor, polite and friendly staff, HUGE bed, and, most importantly, one of the cleanest, best-kept hotels we've ever stayed at. For those of you who hold the cleanliness of accomodation to be important, look no further in Paris than here. They also don't have carpets in the rooms, but very nice (warm) wooden floors... Oh, and they have very nice bath/show products (shower gels, shampoos, bath robes, towels). Don't steal them (we didn't), just enjoy them! Waters

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: WisLaker
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here in late April/early May - it was exactly as indicated in the TripAdvisor reviews - great location, wonderfully courteous and helpful staff, and a terrific room with windows opening out over the street. The room was spacious and immaculate - even nicer than I could have hoped. They thought of everything - from the chocolates on the bed at the evening turndown service to the going away present on our departure. I have nothing but positive things to say and we look forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but a litte dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: DebbieandMark
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Elysee Regencia, which we chose mainly based on the excellent reviews that this hotel has received via Trip Advisor. As this was a break to celebrate our anniversary, we decided to splash out on the Lavender Suite, which looks truly beautiful on the hotel website. We arrived at the hotel and were welcomed by Aline who was extremely helpful and were very impressed with the reception area and bar, where we enjoyed a lovely glass of wine while our room was prepared. Five minutes later we were shown to our room, which was beautiful. We were particularly impressed with the champagne, fruit plate and hand written note from the staff, welcoming us to the Elysee Regencia and hoping that we had a lovely anniversary. We were also impressed with the rose petals on the bed, although a little disappointed when they turned out to be fake! We can’t fault the quality of the room on any front apart from one. Having booked the best suite in the hotel we had hoped for a view, however, the suite is on the ground floor, and not only does it not have a nice view, it doesn’t have any view, as the glass windows are frosted over. You could not even open a window to let air into the room. Temperature wise this is not a problem as the air-conditioning was more than adequate, but it was slightly disappointing and the room did feel a little dark and claustrophobic. Apart from that, the room was wonderful, with a gorgeous bath, which we enjoyed with the lovely toiletries and champagne from the mini-bar. The bar in the hotel, although quiet, does make a fantastic Mojito, the wine is lovely and the service first-class. We never ventured to the breakfast room but did enjoy breakfast in our suite one morning, which was good. The area itself, although beautiful, and quite central, is very quiet and not the place to stay if you are looking for a more lively atmosphere. The only final issue with the Elysee Regencia was a problem with a restaurant recommendation on our second night. A booking was made for us at the Bistro Olivier at the recommendation of one of Elysee staff. We were a little unsure when we first arrived at Bistro Olivier, being the only customers there, but considering the quietness of the area, thought that perhaps we should give it a shot as the hotel undoubtedly knew the good restaurants better than we did. After ordering our meal, we became more worried with the musical choice of the restaurant (Gloria Gaynor’s ‘I Will Survive’) and the distinctive sound of a microwave in the background. We were treated to a dubious, complementary asparagus soup, of which we sampled half, before our starters arrived. One bite of the microwaved goats cheese and soggy tinned vegetables in front of us convinced us that it was time to make a sharp exit, so we paid for what we had had, and left. Whatever you do, don't go there!!!!! The next evening, unfortunately, we didn’t manage to make up for the terrible meal of the night before as planned, as a bout of food poisoning ensured that we were kept to our suite at the Elysee, with one of us ill. However the room service enjoyed by the other was apparently very good, although it didn’t make up for missing our last night in Paris. Obvioulsy this wasn't really the Hotels fault, but they had recommended the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend highly for excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyandCorey
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth stay at the Elysees Regencia and we love the location, staff, and great value offered by this hotel. What strikes me most is how professiona all of the staff are (front desk, bell hops and maid service) and yet how much like a family the place feels. I know that each person there wants me to have the best stay in Paris. It is wonderful. Recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Had been looking for a romantic hideaway”
Reviews.Author: SurreySiggy
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. 5th choice due to all other hotels being booked up - probably due to french election. Pretty spacious room for Paris. Nice balcony although you couldnt really see any sights from it. The Arc was just up the road but due to the rooms positioning you couldnt see it and Eiffel tower was obstructed by flats opposite. That said, it was in a extremely good location and the staff were extremely helpful ad courteous - I cant emphasis that enough. Overall a great stay.. would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very freindly, convenient location, excellent modern room”
Reviews.Author: Alfarom
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris late evening and wanted to stay somewhere convenient and not too expensive since we had no time in the hotel. This was perfect, and it wasn't too difficult to park nearby. We were pleasantly surprised by the room, and had we wanted to watch TV there was a plasma of a decent size, with a good selection of channels. Staff very friendly too, so it was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Most Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Paramount81
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Paris at the end of our European vacation. The Elysee Regencia was a lovely respite from our daily siteseeing. Our standard double room was of moderate size, nicely appointed and very comfortable. The bath was small but bright and cheerfull. The breakfast buffet is excellent. The location is close to the Arc and the Champs Elysees. The hotel staff were very helpful and extremely plesant.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend it to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Finer_things
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel during our recent stay in Paris. The location of the hotel is perfect being only a short walk from the Champs Elysee, the Arc de Triomphe and the Georges V metro station. The photos of the rooms on travelocity did not do the hotel justice, we had a double room on the 5th floor that had a king size bed, balcony and a view of the Eiffel tower. The decor is modern and funky and the mini bar prices are no where near as steep as the many cafes along the Champs Elysee. The staff were really helpful, booking restaurants and taxi's for us most evenings (by the way the meal we had at Alcazar in St Germain was one of the best I have had), and generally were eager to please. I wouldn't hesitate in returning to this hotel the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: vhuk
Reviews.Content: What can I say - what a brilliant hotel! This was our first time in Paris so we searched lastminute.com for somewhere close to the Eiffel Tower / Champs Elysees and this came up as the highest rated hotel in the area on Tripadvisor. The reviews are spot on, what a find! The hotel decor is a bit unusual but it's very nice and really works. We stayed in a room on 5th floor which had a small balcony and view of the top of Eiffel Tower. As far as I can tell most of the rooms do not have a balcony, only those on the 5th, the ones below and above have windows so the balcony is a real bonus if you can get it - nice to stand out and watch the lights on the top of the Tower. The room wasn't huge but I gather this is normal in Paris, nevertheless it was well laid out with lots of space. A minor problem is the lack of draws but there is ample cupboard space. The bathroom is a good size and the toilet is separate which is a good idea. Towel changes are twice daily and we came back to our room every night to find the duvet turned down with a chocolate on the bed for each of us. The hotel staff are very friendly and their good grasp of English more than made up for our lack of French.
