One thing we found a bit weird is that they ask you to drop your keys off whenever you go out, it's a bit annoying at first, especially if you keep forgetting things! But you soon get used to it. The room had pretty much everything you need, hairdryer, TV, minibar, safe, toiletries, tea/coffee making facilities. I didn't notice an alarm clock but we had one with us anyway so not a problem. Try the buffet breakfast service, it's not cheap at 18 Euro each but it includes a glass of champagne and all you can eat. The service was great and it's held in the hotel cellar which is very nice with a great atmosphere. Bit of an expense but how often do you go to Paris? In terms of location the hotel is perfect. Arc de Triumph is less than 10 mins walk, Eiffel Tower less than 15. Nearest Metro is 5 minutes away on George V Ave and you are pretty much spoilt for choice for restaurants in the area. Girlfriend is a very fussy vegetarian but we found 3 great restaurants with good vegetarian choices within easy walking distance of the hotel - Findi on George V Ave (5 min walk), Ziti on Rue Pierre Charron (less than 10 min walk), Trattoria Dell'Angelo on Ave Rapp (just over the Seine, 15 min walk). A couple more tips - there are quite a few good shops in the street next to the hotel (out of hotel, turn left, then first right), here you'll find a supermarket, wine store, bakery, and a cluster of other useful places. There's a very late opening supermarket on Rue Galilee (off Ave Marceau where the hotel is located, turn left out of hotel then 2 or 3 streets on the left) - very handy for late night shopping for drinks and snacks. It was open until at least midnight, possibly later. If you get a chance, go up the Arc De Triumph at night, the views are great and if you're there when the hour passes you'll get to see the Eiffel Tower twinkling. Beware the 280 stairs though! The next time we go to Paris we'll definitely be visiting the Elysees Regencia again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: English_Al
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a find this hotel was. Once again Tripadvisor has come up trumps. I've stayed in Paris a couple of times before and warned my husband that French hotels are normally rather basic, so I was preparing myself to be disappointed. Luckily I could not have been more wrong. First of all, the hotel looked well cared for on the outside. We walked into the reception and were immediately taken with the décor. The reception staff were really helpful and spoke very good English (something else I did not expect in Paris). I still thought there had to be something wrong so I waited tentatively to see our room. Once again, I was most pleasantly surprised. The décor was lovely (we had a fuschia room), the room was spotlessly clean and even the bathroom was superb. This may sound basic but there was a good shower with water temperature that did not fluctuate. Not only that, it was stocked with L’Occitane products. Although breakfast was not included, we opted for the buffet breakfast, which was excellent and even included a glass of champagne. Once again, the staff were really helpful and spoke English. The location of the hotel was great too. We had a reasonably quiet room yet the hotel was only 5 minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe and a 15 to the Eiffel Tower. I cannot fault this hotel and would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service in an exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: raycongo
Reviews.Content: We were there for the Easter weekend '07 and not a bad word to be said of this hotel. Room, service, location, price - it was an absolute pleasure to stay there. I chose this hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews, and was not let down in the slightest.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Frenchbantam
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 3 nights at the end of March. Firstly, the location of the hotel is excellent, being only about 200 metres from the L'Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysee. Upon arriving we were given a very good welcome and all our questions about the area were answered with great enthusiam. Although the rooms were slightly on the small side they were well appointed with all the amenities needed. The bathroom products form L'Occitane were a great bonus. Throughout are stay we were very pleased with the attitude of the staff and the cleanliness of the room. They gave us very good recommendations for dinner and none of the restaurants we ate at were disappointing. This is the first time I have been to Paris and I am now of the impression that it is much cleaner, cheaper and friendlier than London. The shopping is much better and that really pleased my wife. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for all the reasons above and hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Anniversary at the Elysees Regencia”
Reviews.Author: SA_Travelller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Elysees Regencia for 4 nights from the 21st March 2007. We had an amzing stay here. The staff at the hotel were excellent. They went out of their way to give us a truly romantic experience of Paris (assisting with Lido reservations, dinner cruises, champagne excursions). Location: The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the Metro (at a quick pace). For our purposes, it was very centrally located, close to the Champs-Elysees (and therefore the Lido), the departure for our dinner cruise and the metro station that goes directly to Versailles. Some may prefer to have a Metro on their doorsteps. The hotel is on a one way road and is not noisy at all. Room: We stayed in a suite on the 6th floor and therefore had none of the typical complaints about small Parisian rooms. Rooms were clean, well stocked mini bar, good quality linen. The towels were changed twice a day. The TV channel had a few English channels (Sky, BBC, MTV), but no inhouse movies. The bath and shower were a good size. The bed was comfortable and there was ample cupboard space. The staff don't kick you out early to start cleaning the room - they wait for you to leave before entering the room and you are hardly aware of them. The champagne and note on the ocassion of the anniversary was a nice touch. Food Nice looking piano bar - however, we did not drink here. nor did we eat breakfast at the hotel - which seemed a little steep at the price. The location of the hotel means that there are plenty of bistros and cafes close by. We also did not use the room service. General Free high speed internet was a real bonus. Baggage store was also very useful. Possible cons: - not on top of a metro station (not a problem for us - despite the fact that it was raining whilst we were there) Overall - great value for money!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: an englishman in the south of france
Reviews.Title: “great place to stay , and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: gotoseeparis
Reviews.Content: this hôtel played a greazt part in our excellent first visit to paris , and i will surley book to stay there again , and very soon hopefully

Reviews.Title: “Something missing ?”
Reviews.Author: Sand-grown-un
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, my husband & I stayed at the Elysees Regencia for 4 nights in March, so had time to make a considered opinion about the place. I can't really find anything bad to say about the hotel - a couple of gripes, no drawer space in the room, slamming doors from other guests early in the morning , concierge service a bit erractic. The staff are friendly and helpful and the place is spotlessly clean. However there's something missing - atmosphere ! I noticed a piano in the lobby, but nobody playing it. There was hardly ever anybody in the bar, so there wasn't much opportunity to chat with other guests, pass the time of day. If you want peace and quiet then this is the place for you - but if you like your hotels with a bit of life then choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: irelandkerry
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed here for a few nights recently and we were very impressed. The loctaion is superb...The rooms are clean and modern and the staff were extremely helpful - especially Kathrine. The added extras such as bathrobes and L'occitane toileteries were much appreciated too ! would def recommend this hotel and would love to stay here again on the next trip to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: timofee1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Elysees Regencia for our honeymoon in March. We stayed in the junior suite, on the 6th floor. We were both really impressed with our stay. All the staff were incredibly friendly and polite – I didn’t feel guilty at all for my appalling lack of French vocabulary. The suite itself was lovely, airy, well decorated and very clean. The bathroom was ace with a great bath for 2, lovely l'occitane toiletries and a shower with side nozzles as well. You could even just see the top of the Eiffel tower from the window. The price, although not cheap, seemed very reasonable given the location in Paris. As far as we were concerned it was slap bang in the middle of everything. A very short walk to some lovely restaurants – just ask at reception. As it was our honeymoon the hotel had arranged for a bottle of champagne to be in the room for our first night with a hand written message congratulating us. There were a couple of negatives but they were mostly minor. The sound insulation of the room wasn’t great, and unfortunately on the first night there was a group of lads in the next room who woke us up at 1am. However, a quick phone to reception and all was blissfully quiet. After they moved out, we weren’t bothered by next door noise at all. Although the bed was comfortable and large, I think it a shame that it’s 2 mattresses pushed into one. Although it was very well put together, and didn’t actually bother us much, I would still prefer a large single one – especially on honeymoon. Final niggle was the shower. It’s great but, unfortunately, the drains can’t quite keep up with the water flow if you have the side nozzles on as well. All this means is you have to keep a careful eye on water level in the shower and turn off the side nozzles before water cascades over the edge. I must stress that the above problem really were minor compared to how lovely the hotel and the staff were. Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique style accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: bel80
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for New years, and unfortunately all places were mainly booked out, except for this hotel. It's very clean, quiet, and well presented! We loved it! Can't remember the colour of the room - think it was pink? But I remember loving the wallpaper for some reason...and the stairwell! Didn't stay at the bar at all, or experience breakfast there, but service was fantastic. The staff were always willing to help! As for location...it was about 5-10 minute walk to the next nearest metro, but it's not such a bad walk, and that's all it takes to get to the heart of Champs de Elysees! Make sure you check out the Renault showroom! We loved it! And although it was quite far out, 1728 for dinner was an evening to remember :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Paris Experience”
Reviews.Author: Brighttravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after choosing the hotel based on other reviews- we weren't disappointed !! It is a lovely hotel, with good sized rooms, very comfortable, the staff are extremely friendly and the location is great. I would highly recommend adding this hotel to your paris stay!! (only hiccup was the lighting in the corner - great for setting the mood - but slightly dark when searching your suitcase for something!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandTravel-lover
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel for 4 nights, 1st - 5th March. We found the location excellent. We took the bus fom Charles de Gaulle, were dropped off by Arc de triomphe and was a 10 minute walk to the hotel (however on way back the hotel arranged an excellent mini bus to pick us up at the hotel, well worth the extra money). Close to metro stations, Champs Elysees, nice eating places on rue Marbeuf and 10 minute walk to Eiffel Tower. Stayed in a standard room, very clean, good shower and excellent l'occitane toiletries. We were on 5th floor and could see top of Eiffel tower. Bed was comfortable and hotel quiet. Only negative comment for room was the lighting could have been better. We ate breakfast in hotel once. Food was good but felt it expensive at 18 euro. If you go out of the hotel, turn right and go to end of the road there are a few cafes. The first one you come to on the left does a lovely breakfast for 6.5 euros. Would stay here again. On the last evening the hotel left a small gift on the bed with a hand written note from the manager - a very nice touch. On arrival home we received a nice e mail from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, gr8 service”
Reviews.Author: fun-mumLondon
Reviews.Content: the hotel was gr8, service was really good, room very modern n cute. bathroom v nice with gr8 toilletries!! brilliant location. would definatly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: rblakey3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a wonderful weekend in Paris. This hotel is beautiful and in a fantastic location.It must be one of the cleanest hotels we've stayed in and great value considering the quality and location. The breakfast was lovely and I would recommend the deluxe rooms(we even had a small balcony). My only complaint is our bed was a little uncomfortable and we had to ask for another duvet to put on top of the mattress,but this would not put me of and I would definately stay there again.Gorgeous!!Oh yes my husband has just reminded me the staff were great too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JG&TG
Reviews.Content: Thank you TripAdvisors! My wife and I recently had the pleasure of staying in this hotel based on the reviews and can now highly recommend this hotel as well. A small boutique style hotel in a terrific location with a wonderful front desk staff that doesn't hesitate to speak English, arrange a cab, call a museum, etc., the rooms are tastefully decorated and the bathrooms come equipped with toiletries from l'Occitane. We usually stay in Westin and "W" hotels in the USA and believe this hotel is more on par with the "W". Note: we did notice that the doors to the rooms can make a bit of noise (and we'd recommend they add some weather-strip) but since we always sleep with earplugs that took care of that!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: mikvik
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel in a great location, just a short walk from the arc de triomphe and the champs elysses. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very comfortable. The service was truly excellent and perfect english was spoken. Breakfast is in a fantastic old basement/cellar with children at half price. There are heaps of restaurants nearby as well as a supermarket. The website booking facility is very easy to use and having made an internet booking with some trepidation we were delighted to be greeted by name upon our arrival. I would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - thoroughly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: GMeggs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Elysees Regencia for 3 nights in late December 2006, and we were thoroughly impressed. I travel a lot for business (though was on holiday in Paris), so I tend to have certain things that I look for in any hotels I stay in, and the Elysees Regencia certainly came through with the goods! The staff were very friendly and helpful, without exception. The ground floor reception area was beautiful, with a lot of charm and atmosphere. The lounge area behind reception was great, with a computer set up with free internet access, as well as free wireless access available for those with their own laptops. This saved us time and money. We felt very welcome, and even had a personal note from the Manager welcoming us and wishing us a Happy Anniversary - we thought that was great! Our room was on the first floor, and although it wasn't the largest room we've stayed in, it was more than adequate for the two of us with all of our luggage, and fanatstic value for Paris. We loved the decor in the room - it was neither clinical nor old fashioned as many hotel rooms seem to be in Paris. We had a lovely window overlooking a very Parisian-looking street. The bathroom was large by Paris standards, with a powerful shower, and the toilet was seperate, which I think is a good thing. We loved the L'Occitane toiletries - certainly not your run-of-the-mill! High quality and very French. The turn-down service each night was lovely, with a delicious chocolate and a L'Occitane refresher towelette left on our pillows. The position of the hotel was fabulous - with the Champs-Elysees, The Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe all within close walking distance. The Metro was also just down the road. Despite the close proximity to these busy sights, the Hotel itself was very quiet, despite being situated on a relatively busy street, so we were able to escape the hustle and bustle and get a good night's sleep. There is a lovely little street located just behind the Hotel which has a supermarket, liquor store, patisserie and chemist. It was very handy. We have stayed in Paris a number of times before, and have never enjoyed a hotel experience as much as we did at the Elysees Regencia. We would certainly stay there on our next trip to Paris, and would recommend it to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lamira
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel. The location is excellent very close to Champs Elysses and walking distance to all the main attractions. The room size was great, the bathrooms are new and clean. Most important the staff were very helpful and friendly. Highly recommend this hotel for the rate and accomodations. Its one of your best bets in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and a very pleasant stay at the Elysees Regencia”
Reviews.Author: HML-KSG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elysees Regencia in a (green) deluxe room (47) from Jan 2 til Jan 5, based on TripAdvisor's reviews. To summarize our experience with the Elysees Regencia: it is a very fine hotel. Some pro's: * nice staff, that will help you with booking restaurants * good location (close to the Champs Elysees, subway station nearby (George V)) * nice, clean and quite spacious (for Paris!) room. Nice touch: during the day the room is organized (with the green pillows)differently than in the evening (set up for bedtime, with a chocolate and refreshing towel on your pillow). Bathroom (marbled) is ok, with bathrobes & slippers and l'Occitane tolietry. The bath itself is a bit on the small side though (no problem for us, though) * a very good feature is the separate toilet from the bath * on arrival, we received a Paris tourist guide and a map (we didn't need it though, since we brought our own and we do know Paris a bit A con * you do hear a bit of street noise (traffic noise from the Avenue Marceau), though it didn't bother us really Since we woke up quite late, we cannot say how breakfast was (breakfast being served til 1030 am). We would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dbocca
Reviews.Content: We booked initially for the sister Hotel Bassano but because that one was remodeled we were upgraded to Elysees-Regencia. The hotel is located very close to Champs-Elysees, but on the very quiet Avenue Marceau. This hotel is definitely a very good value for the money, and its staff is the most helpful I've ever encountered in a hotel. They all speak great English and they were all very nice, but I have to specifically mention Nicolas (Nick) and Kathryn, whom I dealt with the most during my stay. I never had breakfast in the hotel (I never woke up before 10:00 AM during my 6 day stay so I could not), so I cannot comment on this aspect. The room was a little dark and for a late and light sleeper like myself the mornings were a little noisy (mostly from slamming doors), but this is really not a big deal. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay there again. One could object that the hotel is not centrally located with respect to the main attractions, however Paris has an excellent metro network and stations are very close to the hotel. We used metro extensively during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: GME928
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend, rooms are a little bit on the small side and could be more lighting, our room overlooked the Avenue Marceau, the refurbished hotel is a breath of fresh air, the staff were excellent, the front desk actually did our on line check in for us. Have a drink in the front bar, the barman certainly knows how to make a drink!! and the next day breakfast is in the vaulted cellars - great setting and good food, waiting staff were very attentive. If you are looking for a less formal friendly hotel where everyone knows your name, try it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brushy
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Paris, It was a birthday present from my Husband a 2 night weekend break. It was a great hotel and a memorable stay to Paris. When we arrived the staff met us with a warm welcome. My Husband booked one of the suites and it was absouletly beautiful. It was a great centrally located Hotel just a stoll away from the Effel Tower and the Arc de triumph, also easy access to the metro. A very memorable weekend and thanks to the staff who were very helpful. Mr & Mrs Doble England

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clmswallow
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location, very close to the Champs Elysee. Easy access to the Metro (Underground) so you`re only minutes away from Paris's main attractions. The staff are very helpful and welcoming. The rooms are a good size, very clean, and are well equiped - safe, mini bar, bath robes, hair dryer, bath & shower, TV, comfortable beds. On our next visit to Paris we will definitely stay here again. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: budbing
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in an excellent location. We stayed in the suite which was absolutely lovely very clean and extremely spacious. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Looking forward to planning our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: MAEL3010
Reviews.Content: The Elysees Regencia is a wonderful little boutique hotel, very well located two blocks down from the Arch de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. The facility has recently been completely refurbished. We took a Deluxe room, which was not overly large but certainly adequate by Paris standards. The room was spotlessly clean and well maintained, with a large king bed, and an attractive modern bathroom with all new appliances. Separate toilet. Good WiFi connection (with cards purchased from reception). The lobby is compact, but there are three pleasant rooms for drinks and a light meal. The staff were exceptionally polite, efficient and helpful at all times. Breakfast choice was a little on the modest side, but quite sufficient. In a city where hotel tariffs generally range from exorbitant to plain outrageous, this little hotel is a real find. The location is excellent, the rooms are clean and attractive, the staff courteous, and the rates very reasonable. All in all, this is the best value for money I have yet to see in Paris. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: eclopvif
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautifull room , perfect service

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robinrunaway
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this fantastic hotel which we would recommend to anyone without hesitation, perfect in every way. The rooms are superb, kept spotless clean and spacious. The staff are pleasant and helpful at all times.Excellent continental breakfast in a really attractive dining room. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from both the Champs -Elyses and the Seine so it is ideally situated.Best hotel we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moorrise
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our wedding anniversay at this great hotel. It is a traditional Parisain building that has been given a very classy modern refurb. The staff are a great asset to the hotel very friendly and helpful and if your French is not up to scratch, they ALL spoke ecellent English. Everything was very clean and effecient and also quiet. We had a wonderful relaxing time, we are used to walking everywhere so its location on the edge of the main area was not a problem. If I had one complaint with the hotel which for me was unexcusable it was trying to get a taxi. I have to say all weekend we had diffuculty getting taxis in Paris apart from when we went to two great restaurants that had cabs outside in 5 minutes of our request. Whilst I understand that there was some kind of convention on in town the weekend we visted, I have never experienced being told that there are no taxis even though we had asked the front desk to book us one a couple of hours in advance. The receptionist who was so apologetic ran out into the street and virtually comandered one, going beyond the call of duty. As I said earlier, the staff are a great asset to this great hotel. I would have no hesitation in recommending it (as long as they sort the taxis out!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel and its Staff.”
Reviews.Author: D&LPiver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located near the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees and gave us ready access to the city of Paris and its environs (e.g. VERSAILLES). The key here is its staff who take a personal interest in helping its guests, from booking sight seeing tours to local restaurants and answers to your many trivial travel related questions. With only 43 rooms you become more than a quest, you become their responsibility. We were wecolmed by all the staff, but were impressed with Townsend and Nichlas at the front desk and Saraht, who acted as Bartender, but also helped us figure out the room safe! The trip to this hotel could have been business or pleasure, but for us it was a 40th aniversary trip to A City we will always love and a trip made better with a stay at the Elysees Regencia. Lee and Donna Piver Boston, MA

Reviews.Title: “Very Professional & Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tony_Josette
Reviews.Content: We loved all aspects of this Hotel. We stayed for 3 nights and we found out that the Hotel's staff are very helpful. Rooms are spacious, service is good. Very clean, very quite and very close to all the action in Paris. Highly recommended. Tony & Josette

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Elysees Regencia Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 41 ave Marceau, 75016 Paris, France
